text: The View is amazing, and adds a romantic ambiance to the overall dinning experience. Our servers were very attentive without hovering, we got a bottle of wine, which they kept chilled at the bar for us. We got the lump crab & artichoke dip, which was delicious, and a very ample portion, so much so I opted for a salad and soup for dinner (pathetic I know while at a steak house, but the boyfriend let me try some of his steak). The wedge salad was pretty standard, good dressing, but had 2 pieces of almost whole bacon, not crumbled. The French onion soup was fabulous, cheese was nice and crispy on top, and a good amount of onions. The boyfriend got the Ribeye, perfectly cooked to medium, and nice grill marks and a juicy center. We will be back.

I'd probably say 3.5 stars.
The food was pretty average. The lobster bisque despite the hype was merely OK. The crab cakes were good. Our steaks were cooked properly, but again, were really nothing special. 
They couldn't serve me a witch doctor (supposedly a specialty drink of theirs) because they were all in use at the nightclub. What, special glasses or something???? I didn't understand that very much. Anyway, that was a con and we both felt the prices were too high for the quality presented. 

We did walk out on the roof top and the view is amazing so that was a plus. 
Overall is was a decent experience, but except for the view nothing was even close to spectacular.

I always eat here when I visit.  The food is great, and the view spectacular, but the service is outstanding. At our most recent visit, it took about ten minutes to be waited on....not a big deal to us.  However, the manager immediately came over and apologized and told us our meal was on him.  Wow...do they care or what?  Will I continue to eat here?  Absolutely!  Will I recommend this place to everyone?  Of course.  All high end food establishments should care this much!

Came here for my Fiance's birthday. The dinner was pricey because we decided to get a bottle of wine. The food was delicious and the views were great! Get the bananas foster....you wont be disapointed!

We had reservations for 7:00pm last night.  I can't say enough how fantastic of a night we had.  From the wonderful elevator ride to the top.  To the hostess that greeted us when we walked in.  To the beautiful table we had (we were on the West side so we looked out to the mountains)(if you want to see the strip views - ask for the East side or a view of the strip) Regardless ALL views at the top of the Rio are fantastic!
Well JOHN our waiter was WONDERFUL.  He was tentative, funny, informative about all items on the menu and I am so glad that we had JOHN as our drinks, bread, salad and our main course was served superbly!  After we received our drinks (and before our salad) JOHN suggested we go out on the balcony of the Voodoo Lounge and check out the view.  WOW it was amazing!  we sat out there with our drinks for about 20 minutes.  Taking photos and just enjoying the spectacular sights!  JOHN let us kow that if you eat dinner you have access to the Voodoo Lounge all night.  We told him we had Penn & Teller tickets - so he told us to come back after the show and enjoy the night in the Voodoo Lounge.  How cool is that?  Free entry to a club in Las Vegas.  WOW!
As soon as we walked back to our table - JOHN served our salad.  JOHN was on the ball!  Boy, I sure hope Voodoo Steak realizes what a gem JOHN is to have as an employee.  We finished up our meal.  All unbelievably cooked to perfection.  I had the salmon and my husband had the rib eye.  Baked potatoes for our sides.
Well we knew we had to leave soon as the show was soon upon us.  We didn;t want to go.  We just wanted to stay up there all night.  So back down that fabulous elevator and onto the show.
What a great night!  Penn & Teller we great and a huge THANK YOU to the RIO Hotel for entertaining us!
Cheers!

I enjoy the VooDoo Steakhouse and I would say that the bartender Kenny makes it extra special.  We love to sit at the bar before dining and watch Kenny in action.  He can maintain a great conversation, a talent of a true bartender, while mixing up a lot of drinks for the wait staff and other guests.  Years ago the InterContinental in NYC had a famous, long-term bartender, I think the Rio could brag about having Kenny!

Wow... Awesome experience! Me and my wife had the best steaks of our lives here T the voodoo lounge! Great service and the food was far beyond our expectations. And the prices were not that bad being as nice of a place as it was! Highly recommend for anyone wanting a special night to remember while having the best steaks I've had in Vegas period!

We decided to give this place a try before seeing Penn and Teller. The view was awesome and our dinner was delicious!! The service was steady and we never felt rushed. 
The bread basket was full of a tasty assortment, and refills came easy. We all ordered various steaks which were cooked and seasoned to perfection! The seafood pasta was also rich and delicious. We loved all the sides we tried: the truffle Mac and Cheese (the best!!), creamed spinach, mushrooms, sautéed broccoli, and potato purée. To top off this amazing meal, when we mentioned to our waiter we were seeing Penn and Teller we got 20% off our bill! Awesome all around!

The food was great! We had booked through a full girls night package and all expenses were taken care of in advance. The Waiter seemed to have the attitude that we were not making him any money and he did not want to be serving us. We tipped well over the bill price if we would have had a bill. The view was great once you went outside to the balcony. The windows on the side of the restaurant were so dirty that you could not see the beautiful view from the inside. Overall great food, clean inside, and perfect at sunset.
The restaurant this is a great restaurant. There is great steak here. The service is excellent. A beautiful view of the zip line. This is at the Rio Hotel. I really enjoy eating here.

Thought I'd put this one out here... Your dollars can certainly be better spent. Regardless of the Vegas premium you pay for some of the finer restaurants, this place is straight up not worth it- period. Yes, it's 50 floors up and looks great at night but all of that is haunted by below average appetizers, over priced wine (seriously over priced..), and some of the saltiest fare one can purchase. I'm not going to rail every dish but some notables or warnings would be to avoid the coconut shrimp (laughable..could bounce all the back up from 50 floors), lobster bisque (I've had better from the grocery section), and the Voodoo Caesar salad. I will say that the Caesar reminded exactly of the tray of salad you can get at Costco with a little siracha mixed in, might try that at home..

In short, pop in for a cocktail and a picture then bail.

Cheers!

Husband and I came here for dinner prior to seeing Penn and Teller.  This wasn't our first pick in places to go but due to logistical issues we thought it would be best to eat at the Rio before the show.  

We made a Wed night res (that morning) via open table.  The res was early, due to the show time, maybe 630 ish.  We did get a window seat with a wonderful view without requesting it.

We arrived on time and were seated promptly.  We started with sangrias and French onion soup.  The soup was ok, little too much meat flavor (maybe lamb?) for my liking.

For dinner I had the lamb dish over pasta.  It was ok, but very fatty meat.  Husband had the filet.  He requested it med rare with horseradish crusting.  It was cooked more to med well.  The horseradish was really not a crust as much as it was a thick horseradish sauce on the top.  We shared the fingerling potatoes - they were fantastic.

Took a bit of time to get the check but the staff seemed very busy, so I give them a pass offer that.  Other than that, service was good and servers were pleasant.  

The best part was that we got a surprise 25% off the check when we showed out show tickets.

Overall, great view, ok food, good service, and the price isn't so bad if you get the 25% discount.  I would not recommend for dinner, but you should go to the bar, have a cocktail, and take in the view.

The view is extremely good, the wait service was excellent (thanks Sam) its nice to have an engaging but not overbearing waiter.  Our food was very good...the filet melted as soon as it hit our mouths and the seared scallops...wow.  

We will be back.

We had dinner reservations for 5pm for my mom's 57th birthday. Service was ok, we were hounded by the photographer standing over our table waiting to retake our pics. My aunt ordered crab cakes An wedge salad an was pleased. My mother An I order the filet. I return my first filet due to being over cooked. The second filet came out better but still a bit dry. Unfortunately my mother An I both ended up sick (on her vacation birthday night) less then 2 hours after dinner. It had to be the steaks my aunt was perfectly  fine. The remainder of my mothers birthday we both spent  in the bathroom all night. Not such a happy birthday.

We have been to many restaurants in Vegas and this is now one of my favorites.  The wait staff was superb and very friendly.  It's nice sometimes, to sit down and enjoy your meal without someone coming to your table every 5 minutes to ask if everything is ok.  Here, they have class and trust that their food is good so no need to ask continuously.  The atmosphere is romantic and the food is delicious.  We started with the Lobster Bisque and the French Onion Soup.  Then had entrees that simply melted in our mouths...the Menage a Trois was to die for....a filet so tender, lobster tail and shrimp with creamy potatoes and veges.  The outdoor terrace was an added bonus.  What a view!  Pricey, but then what isn't in Vegas.  You get what you pay for :)

Had the worst experience in terms of customer service tonight. Went in with my family to have a nice dinner but literally got treated like trash. 

Our server was Jose and our reservation was at 8pm. My mom ordered a rare New York steak and when the meal came, she cut it in half to see if it was cooked right. The steak looked more like a medium-medium rare. While waiting for Jose to come around, my mom took photos because despite the mistake, she appreciated the steak. When Jose finally came around, she mentioned that the steak was not rare and instead of just simply taking it to the kitchen, he said, "Well it's been about 30 minutes already since you've had it" first off, it wasn't 30 minutes, more like 10-15. And he was NEVER around! 

So he finally agrees to take it to the kitchen, and when he brings it back, he brings the SAME steak but now it's cut up into 4 pieces basically saying that the chef insists this is RARE. Not only that, he was rude enough to say, "I can bring you a raw steak if you'd like" basically insulting us as customers. 

And even through all this, my mom still tipped the waiter which I wish she didn't. But then again I wish we never went here at all. It's unfortunate since we stay at the Rio often but this experience was by far the worst I've had at a restaurant. On top of that, it was my aunts birthday we were celebrating and it just became the most disappointing night out in Vegas we've had.

The hostess had an attitude...but our waiter was great. The food was pricey but amazing and the views are phenomenal..unlike anything in Vegas! The elevator view going up was worth the prices alone. Totally worth going, especially if you're staying at the Rio (we were).. the French onion soup was delicious & my friends loved the rib eye.. I would definitely recommend it!

We love Steak Houses and are willing to pay Top $$$ for a great Steak!
This Place has a great View from Las Vegas and OK Service, ..... BUT....
the aged 20oz Steaks were tough and totally bland! We had better Steaks at the Black Bear Diner for much much less! The Servers think they are doing you a favor and it seems like they all think what a sucker of a customer is coming in! The side dishes had no flavor! 2 Stars for the View and the Deco...but really? 400 Dollar for a lousy Steak Dinner with a Bottle of Wine incl. Tip??? Don't waist your time and money, this Place needs Chef Robert Irvine for a Restaurant Rescue and the present Chef needs to go or chance his talents! I make better Steaks than that at home on my BBQ Grill! The reason we go to a "out of the ordinary Steak House" is to experience something great and something you can't do at home! 
What a waist of Time and Money! Sad Sad Sad !
Dinner was delicious as was the service and the view on the 50th floor of the rio.decor was different  but the meal was great as was the show the rat pack returns.this was the reason we were there .

My wife and I ate dinner at VooDoo on Monday March 21,2016. Views of LV were great.  Service was poor due to lack of staff.  Waiter was friendly but maybe he had too many tables, My $48 pork Chop was dry and overcooked, and green beans were under cooked.  How hard is it to cook green beans... For the price, I will not return.  but maybe a bad night, so judge for yourself...if just for the views.

Food was good but it's hard to look past the price tag of the entrees and of course the steaks are a la carte.  We made a reservation for our anniversary because it was recommended but it wasn't at all crowded.  The place could use some updating and a lot of tables had random mismatched chairs.  The view was nice but it wasn't a "take your breath away" view, I think there is a certain side of the restaurant to sit on that has a better view.  They don't put the prices on their drink menu which I hate.  My husband and I ordered the 'witch doctor' and it was huge!  We tried to pace ourselves so we didn't get too drunk because it was still early in the night.  I much admit we were both slightly disappointed in how fine we felt when it was gone.  The drink ended up costing $40 which the waiter of course didn't tell us when we ordered but we heard him tell another couple how much it was when we were done.  The water was refilled frequently but our used bread plates sat for while on the table.  Overall, good experience but probably won't be going back anytime soon.

Others have commented on the "oldness" of this place, and I can see that. It definitely doesn't have the swank or hip vibe of other restaurants in the same price range. And it's not necessarily where the beautiful people work or dine. BUT I had the best crab cake there, and the best Chilean Sea Bass. I thought the sweet sauce was going to ruin the CSB, but it was delicious and perfectly cooked and I couldn't stop eating it. Hubby got the menage a trois - the filet was awesome, the prawns were pedestrian and the lobster tail was okay. The view was great - we didn't make reservations so they put us in a booth away from the windows (which was fine), but the window seats had great views. All in all, it was good and I didn't walk away feeling disappointed like other pricey restaurants. Oh, the wine was good (I think it was a Pinot Grigio), but not the best.

Complete scam!! Got discount food tix from tix4tonight!
I have done this before with good 25% off whole check.
This time we were required to show our coupon to hostess and server before being seated or served.
Confident we were given an over priced menu!!!!!! Able to compare online menu; as service so slow full 8$ more on our menu!!!!! 
Beware!! Complain!!

Had the lobster seafood pasta. It was great. Others in my party had the filet and the baked chicken. They were good, but nothing special. The truffle Mac and cheese was a little over loaded with truffle, but tasty. We also ordered the asparagus. It was very good. We never ordered drinks because we were not offered a drink list. Overall the food was very good, but the service didn't warrant the $45-$60 price that we paid for entrees. I don't think that I would go back due to the underwhelming service. However I might get the pasta to-go. It was yummy.
Great ribeye! The service was good. There when you needed service but not constantly interrupting our dinner.

The view was great, and the food was delicious, but the service was pretty much the worst I've ever received.  My husband and I are young and not big drinkers, so we're no strangers to having restaurants assume we won't tip well, but the staff at Voodoo really took that to a new height.

To start off, we had a 6:00 reservation and weren't seated until almost 6:30.  Wouldn't have been a big deal, except that three or four couples who arrived after we'd already been waiting for almost twenty minutes were all seated before we were.  Not sure what's up with that when they tell you that they can't hold your reservation for more than ten minutes.

Then our server, Christian, came over to introduce himself, and from the first words out of his mouth, he was brusque almost to the point of rudeness and, frankly, just seemed pissed off to be waiting on us.  I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt, since it's the night before Thanksgiving--maybe he was bummed to be at work the night before a holiday--but I could hear him interacting with the tables around us, and he was friendly and talkative to them.  He sounded irritated every time he spoke to us, was flat-out rude when he came to bring us our check and get us a to-go box for the food we couldn't finish, and remained just as rude and impatient when we paid the check and gave him a good tip.

I loved their food, but being treated like I'm an inconvenience because someone assumes that being young and sober = being a shitty tipper kind of ruins the dining experience for me, especially when I'm eating at a fancy restaurant.  It would have been nice to be able to go out on a nice date with my husband without being treated like second-class citizens for being in our early twenties.
Great view of the Strip, a little pricey but the steak was great so were the deserts. It's worth a try.

I don't normally give out negative reviews, but this case warrants it. My fiance and I went here to celebrate our engagement. We had saved for awhile and decided to splurge here. We should have chosen differently. The service was decent, our server was fairly attentive. The food was disappointing...for the price of the steaks, I would have expected something a little more on par with Gordon Ramsay Steak. The real issue came after we got home and later that night. We both became quite ill, with signs and symptoms indicating food poisoning. We called and informed the restaurant and were brushed off, stating they "would look into it." No apology or renumeration was offered.  So if you're looking for excellent service and superb steak, go to Gordon Ramsay's!

It's 9:30 place is empty, still waiting for our food, we ordered it 45 minutes ago.
I would NOT recommend or return.  It is also $$$$

This is a fancy steakhouse and you should expect high prices.  The presentation is fantastic they managed to make salads into art.  The flavors are great and Louisiana inspired.  This place has some of the best ambiance in Las Vegas.  I love the very dim lighting and the amazing views from atop the Rio.

There is no denying the views are amazing. This and the wonderful service are what makes this place great. The bread was rather blah. We started with the steak tar tar which was quite delicious along with the crab cake which sat in a tartar sauce and was also delicious with a great crunch on the outside. I got the filet medium rare and it came out perfect. He got the dry aged ribeye, but he was rather disappointed by the lack of flavor and surprised how tough the steak was. Keep in mind it was cooked medium rare so should have been much more tender. We got the mashed potatoes which were average. We also got the asparagus which was undercooked and topped with sautéed onions throwing off the flavor profile. We did enjoy the outside deck with breathtaking views and free entry to the upstairs lounge.

Short Version:  Atmosphere is great along the view of the strip from the 50th floor.  Our waiter, John, was extremely nice and attentive. Food was excellent.  Star entree of the evening was the dry aged rib eye steak cooked medium.  Nice redness to it, buttery texture, and VERY flavorful.  I also liked the Chilean sea bass, with its soft texture as well.  Filet Mignon was good, but just not great.  Lobster tails were cooked nicely.  I would recommend the lobster bisque as well.

Extended version: Rio's automated reservation system was frustrating.  After trying multiples times to get through, we figured no one would man the phone until 5 when they open.  We called back and asked for a Saturday 6:30 pm reservation for 6 plus a baby (kids definitely allowed, so that's a plus) but were told only 6 pm was available, so we took it.  The dumb thing was that at no time was the restaurant more than half full, even by the time we left.  And two of the big tables next to us remained empty the entire time.  You get to see the view from the elevator ride up.  There's only three available stops: ground floor casino, 50th floor restaurant/zip line, and 51st Voodoo Lounge.  You can go on to the balcony while waiting for your food to look at people riding the zipline (purchase your tickets before coming up) and the beautiful view of the strip.  You still have a good view from your seats though.  
The wine by the glass selection for a steakhouse wasn't good at all.  I counted three cabs total available, one of which was Kendall Jackson.  That's the one thing I don't like about Vegas restaurants.  It's not about what wine goes good with your menu, it's more about who's giving you the best deal.  I would've loved to order a bottle of Honig cab for $86, but there was only one other casual wine drinker.  I ended up with a glass of Stags' Leap Petite Sirah for $17, which paired well with steak.  I wish there were some better cabs available by the glass.
For starters, we had the cocktail shrimp (it was good, not easy to mess up simple shrimp), artichoke dip (also good), and coconut sugar cane shrimp (I forget the name of the sauce it came with, but it was excellent).  There were no entrees really for a kid, so we ordered a bunch of sides to split: French fries (minus the Cajun), Mac & Cheese (hold the truffle, oh well), asparagus (good), and potato puree (hard to mess up mashed potatoes).   
The dessert menu was a little disappointing.  We saw online before we got there that they served a dessert fondue and chocolate lava cake.  But they recently pared their dessert menu down to five things and ice cream.  We ended up getting cheesecake (definitely below average) and bananas foster (presentation was better than it tasted).  
One drink ($4-20), one starter ($15), one side ($8), one entree ($40-$76, ribeye is $46), one dessert ($10) will set the average person back about $100 before tax and tip.
I'm taking off one star (and a half?) for the wine list and desserts. 
 Here's a tip:  Sign up for a player's card in the casino.  Rio (part of Harrah's) offers $1 or $2 off most menu items in all/almost all of their restaurants for members.

Just had dinner after spending a day in 100 degree heat. Asked for water to drink with our meal.  "Just tap water is fine" we said. The bill came and $80 was charged for the water we had with our meal.  For our water. They were probably trying to find a way to get more money out of our group because we weren't drinking enough of their overpriced drinks. Who knew their water was going to be overpriced too. To top that off the filet was dry and the server was unable to answer questions about the menu.  If you are going to spend top dollar for a meal you have much higher expectations than this.

Last night I ate at the Voodoo steakhouse. The staff was exceptional. The food was amazing. The prices were average for that type of meal.  The view was beautiful. You could see out the windows over the whole city it was dark and you can see all the lights I really enjoyed it.

What can I say? This place was delicious and also has a breath taking view! Food was definitely worth the money. I ordered the lamb and it was cooked to perfection! Our waiter was super friendly and very helpful with answering all of my questions!
The best steak I have ever had! The service was amazing and everything you should come to expect! John, our waiter, thank you!!!
Not bad. Have had better. It's pretty pricy. You mostly go for the view?? I think Gallaghers is a much better steak house but thought we would try something different.

Service was terrible.  Rarely were our water glasses refilled and empty dishes remained on the table for 10+ minutes.  Not what I would expect for a $400 dinner for four people.  The food was good, but not great.  Go for the view but not for the meal.

Went there early and on time for our reservations last night.  We we're a party of 4 so we should've had dinner and made it to our show on time, NOT!  Over an hour waiting for our dinner and the couple next to us who arrived much later, received their food. Our waiter acted offended that we called this out and tried to tell us to wait a little more.  Bottom line,  the menu looked good,  we are happily anticipating a nice experience but that never happened.  Very- very disappointing! Oh and this was dinner on a wed. By 7pm.

Nice view and atmosphere!!
steak is OK.
scallops are a little bit too salty. 
asparagus are perfectly cooked!
sorbet with dry ice has very impressive presentation.

This is probably my favorite place in vegas,great view,great food,money well spend.
If you like to go out of the strip(i like to) you will love this brazilian stile casino,great service fresh food good atmosphere 
The service is attentive and very polite,i ise to go in vegas 5/6 time a years and i try to visit this place everytime

Food was pretty good. The power company had an outage so during dinner it was about 90-95 degrees up there which made dinner pretty miserable. The manager said "we can't control Nevada power." Creamed spinach was no good. Lobster   bisque was amazing as was the cream brûlée.  The steak just ok.

We ordered the lobster bisque soup, pan seared scallops and mac and cheese. The food was mediocre, nothing amazing, definitely not worth the $40 - and up prices per dish. I've had better. The view was nice, the service was ok. Nothing fantastic, matches the rundown hotel experience. At least no bugs in my food. Can't say the same for our hotel room.

Friday night in Las Vegas, one would think that it would be packed.  To the contrary, our server asked us to be patient while he was slammed (we were surrounded by open tables with a 7:30 reservation). 

Steak was mediocre - wife and I shared the ménage a tois steak shrimp and lobster - both the seafood portions were small, chewy, and terribly under-seasoned.   Terrible ambiance and terrible value. Of all the places to get a $100 + dinner in Las Vegas - we won't be returning as neither you should venture here.

My husband and I had dinner on March 15th.  The view is great.  We arrived early for our reservation and were seated immediately.  

The service had a lot to be desired.  I ordered a glass of zinfandel from the wine list.  The server made a point to (rudely) make we aware I was ordering RED zinfandel.  I'm 42 and was dressed appropriately for a nice dinner, so am not sure why he felt the need to let me know my $20 glass of wine was red -- not pink.   The fact that he thought that I he apparently thought I looked like I should be ordering pink zinfandel was insulting.  

My husband asked if they served any mocktails and the waiter gave us a completely blank look, even after we explained what those were.  At the restaurant we went to the prior night, the waiter had an entire list of mocktails available.  

When I ordered a 2nd glass of wine, I asked for the house cabernet.  The server corrected me -- saying they don't have "house" wines.  I clarified that I wanted the featured wine that is on the front page of the wine menu.  In my experience the "featured" wines by the glass are generally considered house wines.  

In other server notes, our water glasses were never refilled, my empty wine glass (1st glass) was never removed, and our dinner was delivered before we were done with our appetizer.  

The food was very good.  My husband had the trio and I had the scallops.  Both were great.

While the food was very good, the poor service makes this a restaurant I'd not recommend again.  There are plenty of other upscale steak restaurants in Vegas with great food and better service.

One of the 3 best steakhouses in the city.  But the view beats them all!

We've eaten here about 5 times now, and only had one problem...eating everything.  Good portion sizes, and the smells from other tables made me wonder what I'd missed!  Our waiter was excellent, and they are very personable, with great stories to tell about the city.  He made use laugh out loud three times!

It is a bit of a wait for the tremendous food, though.  But last time we got the Tomahawk which probably took 30 minutes to prepare.  The drinks were also excellent!

Although it's a bit pricy, it's inline with other restaurants that don't have a view of this magnitude.  

Well done, Rio!
Amazing place to eat!!! Everything was perfect and will definitely be going back.  Voodoo is by far my favorite!!!!

Lobster was amazing, but had to send the steak back as apparently they have no idea what 'medium' is.  Also, HUGE problem with splitting the tab.  Jamal (the server) wouldn't help split it up - he wanted us to pay for jamal together.  ;-)
Extremely nice view and very good food. Went to voodoo and mon Abi Gabi in Vegas and the voodoo was so much better in all aspects, except for price

Voodoo Steak was ok. The best thing is the view from the top of the Rio (50th floor) of the Las Vegas Strip. We had a window table and the view was stunning and we got there before sunset and there to see the sunset, very cool. To start we had a Cheese and Chanteuse plate. It had salami with black truffles that had a great salty, earthy flavor. Also include chorizo, Gruyere, blue cheese, sharp white cheddar and kalamata olives. Also a cranberry toast with 3 jams that were plate licking good! Next was a rich, flavorful lobster bisque except the pieces of lobster were chewy. For a side the Hericot Vert with onions was seasoned well and had a good snap. The bone-in ribeye was a bit over cooked from the medium-rare I ordered. It had a bit to much pepper and overall just an ok steak for the price. Service was good but overall probably wouldn't go back for the food.

After reading the reviews on here, I almost cancelled the reservation that I made for dinner. Many complaints stated that the place was overpriced. I'm not sure where their previous experiences at fine dining steakhouses were based. This is not an Outback or Texas Roadhouse. Upon opening the menu, the price point was exactly what I expected. When I made my reservation, I requested a table by the window, which was honored. 
We started out with the oysters. I personally do not eat oysters, but the other three people in my party do and they were so impressed that they ordered a second dozen. I ordered a crab cake and it was wonderful. It had a crispy breading around it and inside was wonderful shredded crab meat. Delish! I will say that we brought two bottles of wine from our wine collection at home and the corkage fee was an extremely reasonable $25. 
For the entree, we all ordered the Land and Sea Ménage a trois.  Filet mignon, lobster tail and grilled shrimp. Amazing. We all cleaned our plates and also had a side of creamed spinach that made the "non creamed spinach eater" eat his words. 
We ended our meal with the chocolate cake and carrot cake. I was skeptical of the carrot cake because it contains walnuts and pecans and I do not care for them, but they were almost undetectable and the cake was perfection. 
Voodoo is such a wonderful experience with the best view in the city. It's a shame more people don't have better things to say. Until next time...
I like the place by itself , it's nice restaurant on 50th floor with Las Vegas view . But the food meh .. And overpriced .

Had the pleasure of dining during my stay at the Rio in November and it was definitely an experience. 

Dining at the top of the hotel gives you a really nice view of the strip to share with your SO or by yourself, no judgement. 

I had the chicken and it was very delicious with bacon and mashed potato purée.

You definitely pay for the view here.  Its amazing and one of a kind.  I ordered the half dozen oysters and the 12 oz filet mignon.  I honestly enjoyed the oysters more than the filet mignon which i felt lacked any flavor...
Our waiter was super friendly

This was our first and last visit to Voodoo Steak.  Although they receive a star for service and the view; the food was horrible for this type of price tag.

Seating:
Upon arrival they told us no tables were available but had booths. No problem since we didn't have a reservation. Once we entered though there were over half the table's empty. 

Service
This is one of the stars in my review. The service was exactly what you would expect. Very knowledgeable about the menu and made sure we had everything we needed. 

Food
Appetizers were good. We had wedge salad and lobster bisque. Other people in the party agreed that they were well thought out on presentation and taste.
Main courses were steak, chicken and salmon. All three were over cooked with almost no flavor. The crackers on the table had more taste and didn't cost $50.00 a plate.
View
This was the reason for the other star. It was perfect and they have an outdoor balcony that looks over the Las Vegas skyline.  Great for pictures and a little romance!

For $300 plus meal this was a very bad experience. Any of the casino hotels have better food at their buffet and it will save you some cash for the casino's.

My girlfriend and I both had the Filet Mignon I had the blue cheese topping, she the garlic both were delicious. Girlfriend accidentally grabbed her butter knife and was able to cut through her steak no problem. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the service just wasn't quite to the level I expect when spending this much money on a meal.

Here's the thing: bread - excellent, Caesar salad - spicy, tangy, delicious. Wine choices - very good. Salmon and accouterments? Nice. So why two stars - ordered 8 oz filet mignon - cooked right. Served cold. Asked for them to heat it up? Came back charred black. Wtf? This is a steak house and they can't get steak right? For the price ($50) for 8 oz - and the competition in this town for steal houses - I'll pass next time. Not worth it.

Great view, but you pay for it. Service is ok. We came for drinks only so I can't speak for the food. We had one and left. Wait staff was non attentive and it wasn't busy. I guess they were prepping for the night. I may come back just to show someone the view but based on other reviews I will probably only have drinks again.

I've been to many steakhouses, I also have been here when it was the VooDoo Cafe, before it became a full on steakhouse and honestly, I liked it better when it was a cafe. The food was better and the prices were MUCH lower. Me and hubby shared the 32 oz Tomahawk, we brought our 2 kids with us and my daughter had the flat iron steak and my 9 year old son had the Mac and cheese side dish, they have ZERO children's menu options. The tomahawk was good but not great, same with my daughter's steak. The Mac and cheese side dish was the best thing on the table honestly. I did have the lobster bisque before dinner because they always have had this on their menu and it really is amazing! Thankfully they didnt change this recipe. Highly suggest ordering the bisque. We had the chocolate bomb dessert and that was pretty good. But the steaks and the prices they are, in my opinion are not worth it. There are many very good steakhouses in Las Vegas, this one is ok. The service however is spot on.
The food was fine but the service was horrible. With so many great dining options in Vegas, try somewhere other than this place.

Her Majesty and I had tickets to see Penn and Teller so we decided that the easiest thing to do would be to find a nice restaurant in the Rio to eat at before the show.  After looking through their website, we selected the Voodoo steakhouse and made reservations.

Ambiance
Mixed bag here.  The restaurant is reasonably nice and the view from the 52nd floor is outstanding.   The only real negative I have is that the restaurant's website clearly states that they have a dress code but the restaurant seems to make no effort to enforce it.  Seated next to us was a group with backwards baseball caps on and next to them were 4 guys in shorts and t-shirts.  I realize that I am old and so stuff like this probably matters more to me than to most people but my feeling is that if you are going to advertise a dress code then people will use that information to help make their decision whether or not to go there.  If you have no intention of enforcing it, then that seems like false advertising to me.

Food
We started with crab cakes that were dry and burnt to the point that The Empress did not want them.  We then moved to bisque for me and a salad for her, both of which were average.  The main course was lobster thermidor for me and sea bass for Milady.  She said hers was just okay but I was really disappointed in mine.  There was no thermidor sauce that I could find and it was really bland.  Dessert was also pretty average.  Definitely not the quality of food you would associate with the kind of place they are trying to be.

Service
Bad.  We perpetually could not get drink refills because our waiter would disappear for long stretches.  Even then, simple things like offering The Empress some pepper to take away some of the blandness of her salad were overlooked even though he did it for the table right next to ours.

Overall
As you can see from this review, we were pretty unimpressed with the place.  One thing I will add is that I thought it was very low value.  We each had only one drink (because we could not get anyone to get us another one) and still ended up spending almost $200.  There are too many good restaurants in Vegas to waste time on this place.

We come here with some degree of regularity. 
The view from the 50th floor of the Rio is INCREDIBLE! The restaurant is quite pricey, and everything is ala carte, but it's all good and very nicely prepared. The service is good, tho we went early before the crowds arrived. We have tried numerous dishes and were always pleased. I usually have Salmon and find their's quite good. Their lamb was also quite good with generous serving sizes.
Bring your camera and join the crowds taking photos of their group overlooking Las Vegas;  it's quite impressive!
Cristian is the best, top notch for sure!! and he's definitely easy on the eyes!

What a view.  At the top of the Masquerade Tower at The Rio Hotel and Casino.  The menu is a little more than you see at a typical steak house.  Very unique drink menu.  The foi gras was extremely well prepared.  The Ménage e Tois  (filet, lobster tail, Shrimp) entree was excellent.  The bone in NY Strip was perfect.  A go to restaurant

Just came here for dinner and had a good time. The short rib bruschetta definitely stole the show. The steak, whipped potatoes and asparagus were good, nothing to write home about; but that bruschetta: delicious. The service was impeccable. While I didn't have a strip side view the view was still wonderful.
This steak is amazing you could literally cut it with a spoon Service is always wonderful The staff everybody is so friendly and they great you like your friend or family member

Dined here for my 11 year old's bday and they know how to make it special for a 11 year old! Our server Samuel (from NY) was the best! He surprised the boys with their signature witch doctor drink, virgin of course!! Was super cool! Food is amazing and so is the view. We had the coconut shrimp, fried Brie, spinach and watercress salad for appetizer. For entree we had their steak and sea bass which was AMAZING. My husband loves sea bass and thought this was one of the best sea bass in Las Vegas. They have good vegetarian options too. Wine list is very good and reasonably priced. If you chose to bring your own wine, corkage fee is $35. Their chocolate bomb cake was the absolute best! The staff is amazing and very friendly. We avoid strip restaurants for special occasions but voodoo steak goes above and beyond for special occasions, special thanks to Samuel. Would highly recommend.

Took almost an hour just to order food, then took another 45 minutes to get our order. Our steak was ordered well done and we received a medium rare steak. We were in a party of 8 and asked the server to split the bill. The server huffed about it and said "that will take me a really long time so you will need to wait".

Where else can you get a 360 view of Las Vegas, with a nice dinner? Ironically, we came up here, to the 50th floor just to get a drink. But after seeing the view, and a couple great Martinis later, we decided to stay for dinner! Our bartender Antonio was so personable and fantastic. He made the best Martinis and described the best dishes served here. We want with his recommendations. The Lobster Bisque was to die for! So balanced and delicious. The scallops were seared perfectly, and the Huge bone in Rye-bye steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare and juicy! Don't forget the side shoe string fries in the cone, and a cream of spinach. We came in with no expectation, no reservation , and received one of the best dinner of our stay! One more thing, to get to the 50th (or 51 floor VooDoo Lounge), you can only access that elevator from the 2nd floor balcony. No elevator from the ground floor will go all the way to the top...

This place is far from fine dining as you can get. The wait staff is poorly trained. For the prices our silver was never changed between courses. Our side plates were never cleared. By the time we finished our meal our table was a mess of plates uncleared from the starting bread plates. You pay big bucks for poor service and low quality food.

My goodness this place is amazing! Awesome cocktail bar to wait when table isn't ready! The view is AMAZING and their food is great! Our waiter was very attentive and the staff was friendly. The atmosphere in that restaurant is fabulous! We had 3 different kinds of steak and I had the top sirloin and my husband had the rib eye! All was cooked to perfection! We had the side of Mac and cheese and that was very good as well! Check this place out because overall, the food and the view from atop is spectacular! Will definitely be back again!

Ate at the Voodoo twice over the first weekend in May. Considering it was the weekend of the Kentucky Derby and Mayweather fight, we thought it would be a bit busier. It was Actually half empty and the service was average at best. The food is good, naturally a bit over priced. The service is average. The ambience is GREAT and benefits from the after dinner access to the rooftop nightclub. Great way to end the evening. So despite average service and good but overpriced food, when in Vegas we come here for the dinner views and apres-meal rooftop experience.

What a View!  Take the elevator to the top!  This is a good choice for dinner before the Penn and Teller show which is also in the Rio.  View great, Service Great,  Atmosphere Great, Food Very Good.  I will come here again when we're in the area..  Nightclub upstairs opens at eight.  Flexible attire.

We're convinced this restaurant is the reason anyone ever returns to the Rio. If only their hotel provided a comparable quality.

My wife and I were lucky enough to visit Voodoo Steak on the night after our wedding. It was our first dinner out as husband and wife. We also had the good fortune to be seated in Sam's section, and Sam provided exceptional service all night.

To start, we ordered an appetizer and a bottle of wine. After Sam brought over the wine and poured us each a glass, he invites us to go hang out on the outdoor balcony, overlooking the Strip, while the pork belly with apple and caramelized onions was being prepared. We did, and Sam came out about 5-10 mins later to let us know our first course was ready.

We came in and ate our delicious pork belly, and some tasty starter bread.  It wasn't long before my 8 oz. filet mignon with garlic buttery scallops came out with my wife's seared scallops.  We also ordered truffle mac & cheese. All i can say about them is "Wow."  My mouth is watering just thinking back.

As we finished up dinner, knowing our story, Sam provided complimentary champagne flutes. Classy move, much appreciated. We ordered some tasty coffee ice cream to finish the evening, and we left full, extremely satisfied, and impressed.

As we told Sam, we'll be back for our anniversary next year.

Went here the day after the 4th of July. My cousin had never been to Vegas before and I thought what better way to get a view and a good dinner all at the same time.
We bought a voucher at the 1/2 price tickets booth that gave us 25% OFF the entire dinner incl drinks. 
Our reservation was for 7p and we were seated promptly at that time. We got the prized table by the window as well. Too bad a storm rolled through the night before, the windows needed washing.
 When we called  to make a reservation we were told the attire was "smart casual". I guess that means, in America, anything goes but "wife beaters" and swimsuits. I couldn't believe the liberties other diners took in the  dress department. I'm not faulting the restaurant, that's just the way it is these days.

Anyway, we started off with the Witch Doctor Sampler, included were rock shrimp, mini beignets, coconut shrimp and a lone crab Cake. The portion was just right for two to share. The quality of the shrimp was decent, cooked just right but nothing about the sampler stood out, the dish was served surprisingly cool.

My Scallops, on the other hand, were perfectly cooked, tender and succulent! Yum factor quite high. My cousins 8oz Filet was a real treat as well, ordered med rare (as it should be ordered) came out just perfect. She almost didn't need  a knife to cut it.
 We ordered the side of Ragout of mushrooms, fingerling potatoes, asparagus and bacon. Another good call!

All in all, we were quite satisfied with the service as well as the meal, and blown away by the view. (Only with this was a revolving restaurant).

We saved $45.00 by using the voucher and that also got us into the Voodoo Lounge upstairs for free. You have to wander upstairs even if its just for a few minutes to take in the rooftop view.

Next time I would love to sample the buffet, I've heard it is also very good.

The views were spectacular!  The steak was really flavorful and cooked as ordered.  The biggest problem we had was our server.  Due to a food allergy, we informed our server that we needed our sides to be gluten free.  We inquired about the green beans with shallots and almonds and the lemon aioli asparagus as they seemed like they might be harmless.  He told us he didn't think there would be a problem with those sides, but would double check just to make sure.  He never came back, so we assumed it was fine.  When our food came out, we were served plain, dry, barely warmed up asparagus and green beans.  We asked what happened and he said the almonds in the green beans were brushed with flour and the aioli sauce had flour in it so he had them prepare it without.  While we appreciated that he was looking out for the allergy issue, we asked why didn't he come back and tell us this so we could decide on different sides that were gluten free as the main reason we wanted to try those sides were because of the flavors, not just to be given plain steamed vegetables at $11 each!  His response was to just turn and walk away, never to be seen again until he literally threw the check on our table.  We then called over a manager who comped the vegetables and offered us another glass of wine, which we declined.  We just wanted to be done at that point.

Worst service I've had. The bread was cold , and you guys put me in a corner and forgot about me , you put me next to a drunk couple that wouldn't shut up .. and you can't even cook asparagus right ....

Nice high view, food was superb.  Ribeye was good lobster was alright.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  I wasn't expecting all this goodness.  Also cool to go to the Lounge upstairs after dinner.  Guys some of the ladies who leave chippendales come up here.  Voodoo lounge reminds me of less sexier Ghostbar at Palms

I had the menage a trois combo which included a 6 ounce filet mignon, jumbo shrimp, lobster tail with mashed potatoes with a medley of vegetables. I also had the lobster bisque soup which was excellent as a starter. The restaurant was not very busy so I was a little surprised at the poor attention to service. When the waiter checked in to ask me how my meal was I mentioned that the carrots were undercooked and so was the lobster tail. He did not offer to fix it and just looked at me and walked away. Overall I would say the meal was better than average but certainly not worth the hundred dollar price tag for one dinner!

We showed up around 6pm. No reservation. We were immediately sat in a booth with prompt and very friendly service by Samuel and Alejandro. Our meal arrived quickly and was excellent. I had the New York steak and my wife the Scallops. Creme brûlée for desert. This will be on the menu for our next trip.

Hey, hey, hey now. . .. This place is AMAZING! Our reservation had us seated immediately by the window so we could have a lovely view of fabulous VEGAS!  

We started with the Veal cheek. We've never had it before and decided to give it a try. Although it was slightly greasy ( I think that is how it is supposed to be) it was pretty damn good. 
 
For my entree, I chose the VooDoo Menage A Trois which consisted of a 6oz petite filet, 4 oz lobster tail, jumbo prawns and I chose mashed potatoes. SERIOUSLY, oh my gawd! The whole meal just absolutely blew my mind. The steak was perfectly cooked, seasoned, tender & juicy. The lobster was prepared in an amazing sauce & was hands down the best I have ever had!

Pricey? Yes. BUT in this case you get what you pay for. Amazing service, food & ambiance. Thank you VooDoo for making the whole trip worth it!

The service , view, ambiance and food were all excellent!  If back to the Rio I will eat here again.  Jacinto was an excellent server.  There when you want him but he didn't stalk you!!   My filet, lobster and shrimp were all excellent!!  I give it two thumbs up.
It is expensive but worth it.

We went here because we had a groupon for a buy 1 get one steak free.  So glad we decided to give it a shot!  The views are really great of the Strip.  And the best part is you are encouraged to go hang out, outside while waiting for your meal.  Excellent service!  I really appreciated the fact that we weren't rushed and were given really good recommendations from our waiter who genuinely seemed to care that we had a great experience.  I highly recommend making reservations.  We could tell that those who didn't had to wait quite a while for a table.

Let me preface this with the following; I am from Calgary Alberta. We know a bit about beef in Alberta. My butcher in Calgary hangs meat for 14 days then wet ages it for a further 14. I then buy an entire Canadian Prime strip loin and they hang it for an additional 14 days for me. This is perhaps the best beef on earth. We do not have corn fed beef, we have grass fed, barley finished beef that is amazing in quality. The fat is white and these steaks are marbled almost to a Wagyu standard.  

I know how to cook a steak. I lightly season the beef and then sous vide cook it for at least 2 hours at 130 F. I then sit the beef for 20 minutes and finish it a cast iron pan that is nearly glowing with heat. These are fork tender steaks of the most astonishing flavour. 

I have eaten beef all over the world and honestly think this is the best. That said, I acknowledge that U.S.D.A. Prime is also awesome beef.

The steaks at Voodoo don't come close to this quality.

While the room is nice, the view great, and the ambience very good, the kitchen and service are nowhere near where they should be for this level of expense.

And expensive its is. Four of us racked up a 600 buck tab with a fairly good wine selection. We did not order the standard issue 'American' giant slabs of meat, just nice 8 or 10 oz fillets. We had Lobster Bisque and a Caesar Salad for starters.

The Salad was pedestrian at best. The Bisque however was truly great. 

Of the four steaks two were very over cooked, one was very undercooked and one was missing a topping. Zero for Four is not a great way to start a meal.

After refiring the meat and sorting out the topping the cook was fine. The meat, less so. Two of the steaks were dry at medium. The rare steak was bland and the medium rare was mushy.

I was amazed that a place billing itself as a steak house could be so incompetent and cooking steaks. The joint wasn't all that busy, the service was uninformative and lax. The kitchen is a bit clueless.

The wine list is unimpressive and overly expensive. Almost zero good Bordeaux to be had.

I will not return, nor would I ever recommend Voodoo to anyone else.

Group of 10 ate here. Couldn't refill water and didn't know about their own food.  Bread was terrible especially for the price. It was hard bread. Disappointed, especially paying $60 for my meal. Manager was unhelpful and did not provide any customer service. Won't come back. I recommend another restaurant for steak.

The food and location is perfect. My friend and I had the 12 oz filet mignon along with the truffled macaroni and cheese. I saw everyone else's orders and they looked very good. Service was decent but I will warn you.... It is pricey. There is patio outside to smoke and the view is gorgeous. Nice place to go to have awesome steak.
enjoyed dinner during company conference.  Food was on point, menu offered all that could be expected.  Waitstaff was attentive and knowledgeable.   Overall a very good experience and beef

The view was great, the service was good, but my halibut was way too over done. There were 3 people in our party that ordered the halibut and each of us thought it was over cooked. It surprised me that they think this is the way fish should be cooked. The other 3 people ordered steaks and they were all happy with them, I've never had to specify how to have my fish cooked but after this I might need to start specifying not to over cook. You would think that with a $700 meal for 6 people, it would be properly cooked. Anyways, everything else was wonderful.

Menage A Trois would have been an awesome dish.  However, I ordered the steak Medium Rare and got it Medium Well.  I was going to order side dishes, but just as I was about to, the waiter cut me off and informed me that the dish already comes with smashed potatoes and 1 carrot and 1 asparagus.  I had to get the waiter's attention as he did not give us any steak knives either.

Although we got seated immediately for our 6:30pm reservation at a wonderful table with a spectacular view overlooking Vegas, we immediately notice that the restaurant did not have any A/C on.  Our waiter did not even inform us about it.  We looked around and notice fans situated at different areas of the restaurant.  Because there was only 2 of us in our party, we were not privvy to get a fan at all.  With the hot halogen lights shining on us, it got even hotter and uncomfortable.

The table next to us also complained.  To top it off, their waiter forgot about their side dishes.

We would have stayed to order and eat dessert, but opted to leave immediately after our dinner to go downstairs and enjoy the cool air and show in the casinos.

I was apprehensive after reading a couple of reviews but I took my family of four before the PT show and the food and service was excellent.   So much so I had to return here to review to help offset a couple of the others!

Highlights were the view, the $40 shareable smoking Witches run cocktail, artichokes. 

The listing should be $$$ at least however!

Great view, nice & dark, the way I like it. Cocktail list is a little too sweet for me, but they've got a nice wine list & about a dozen beers to choose from. Wait staff is super chill, attentive, accommodating & professional.

Dry aged ribeye was okay, really tasty, but had more tough cartilage than I've had in other dry aged ribeyes. This was my first steak in a long time, about 6 months, so I'm sure my senses were heightened to it, nonetheless, it was still really flavorful.

Tip, as soon as you get a basket of warm bread, put a piece of it over your cold butter to soften it. 

Overall, great spot, would definitely come back.

For starters, we were with a WW11 vet that was turning 91. I told the hostess first thing when she sat us. We had a nice view until we tried to look out the window, which looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a year! The manager came by, we joked about the dirty windows , she said she got another complaint the day before. We also told her about our 91st birthday . There was four of us and we split two steaks and added lobsters to our meals . The lobster was horrible , way over cooked! We mentioned it to our waiter , never asked us if we wanted another, the manager never came over to talk to us about it. Three of our steaks were over cooked. My boyfriend and I didn't even eat our dinner. The waiter came back dropped our check and said they discounted the lobsters and dropped our $300 bill. No birthday dessert after telling two people. I reminded the waiter and he said he would bring something .. too late. I got up , which I never do, working in fine dining myself, and went over to the manager. Told her how terrible the food was and how they forgot the dessert. She said she would adjust our bill and apologized . She took off $30! Such an insult! I told her at the fine dining level, they needed to step it up! That was the most horrible meal I've ever had! Best part of the dinner was the view outside!

The view is beautiful, but the restaurant is not worth the money. 
We ate here October 19th at 6:00pm, the night my boyfriend proposed. It was a Sunday night and not very busy. We were told because we did not have a reservation they could not sit us by the window, but throughout our entire meal there were at least 6 window tables open, that were never seated.
The staff was not friendly and we had better service at the casino buffet.
The nicest person there was the photographer who was so kind and took our picture out on the patio, and to my surprise caught my boyfriend's proposal as well. 
We tipped him better then our waiter.
The food was average. I had the free range chicken, and my fiancé had the Ribeye.
If the service had been a little better, I might consider going back.

This used to be a wonderful place to enjoy amazing food with friends and family but their spark has gone downhill. Unfortunately the food and service doesn't live up to the price. The wedge salad was very disappointing and the macaroni even worse. The New York strip wasn't nearly as flavorful as we expected but the filet was delicious. 
There is a huge positive which is the view and that alone is worth dining for. Sometimes people have to pay to go to the club upstairs but if you eat at the restaurant, you can walk up there and enjoy the view. The drinks are so strong they are almost worth the $15 they cost! The experience here is great but the food is lacking...

I ate here after attending a conference in the Rio Hotel. The staff and food were all fantastic. The presentation of the food was impressive and tasted just as great. Our waiter was very attentive and aimed to please.
the steak was ok...not great... the view was ok. everything was ok.... so do you pay higher prices for ok? 2 stars... sorry.

Ask for Sam.  The food is delicious and the view is wonderful.  I come to Vegas as often as 12 times a year and this place always impresses me.  There is a zip line if you want a little adventure with your dinner.  The patio is a nice place to sit and have a drink.
Amazing food and service!  The waiters are beyond belief, excellent Pinot noir wine, super awesome heirloom tomato salad combined with a ménage trois filet, lobster tail abs jumbo shrimp!

At the top of the Rio.  A/c was out so it was a little muggy. Service was pretty good.

I ordered the Rib eye 20oz. medium rare.  It was on the lean side but pretty good.

The only thing that was disappointing was the wine list.  The first cab we selected was a 2007 and they brought out a 2008.  If we didn't catch it they wouldn't of said anything.  We continued through the wine list and found at least 5 other bottles that had the incorrect year printed on the list.  This combined with the broken a/c was almost a dealbreaker for our group.  Pretty sad in my view.

Sad experience, way under staffed, waiter was pleasant but hurried and cared less what you ordering. I ordered the Dry Aged 20 oz Ribeye medium Rare and it was medium well to well. They offered a replacement but given the show start time and slow service there was no time.

Ridiculous for the price and ambiance of this Restaurant I wo.uld suggest go to the lounge and enjoy the view but definitely plan dinner elsewhere as this one won't get a second chance from this Las Vegas Local.

I was a little worried when I read all the reviews about coming here, I'm not going to lie.  The elevator up was the only scary part as it turns out, hostesses were super nice even though we were about 15 minutes late for our reservation.  Jamal was our server he was so wonderful  and attentive without being over bearing.  We started with some cocktails and the Steak Tartare and it was fantastic, then we had the Dry Aged Rib eye with Broccoli and the asparagus.  It was cooked perfectly to the way we ordered mine was medium rare and my boyfriends was medium! We didn't have more left over for desert so we decided to have another drink and take them outside on their amazing balcony and enjoy the views it was a warm night with a great breeze.  It was a wonderful dinner that much to my surprise ended with a proposal from my now Fiancé! I will be back next time we are in town and I hope that we are treated as wonderfully as this time!  Thank you to Jamal for the wonderful service hopefully we will see you next time!

So incredibly disappointed in this place and their service. We made dinner reservations for 6:45pm when we arrived to our room yesterday afternoon. At 6 we decided to go and sit at the bar until it was time for our reservation. I ordered a corona and my fiancé ordered a margarita on the rocks. Upon receiving her drink my fiancé noticed something floating in it. Once we were able to fish it our, we realized that it was a HUGE bug. She immediately brought it over to one of the managers to show him, and what was his response? Basically nothing. He comped her drink and that was it. I'm sorry but I expected much more from such a "high class" establishment. We opted not to eat there after this, so they lost out on money there. Shame on you voodoo steak for not handling this the right way.

View was gorgeous and loved the restaurant's decor. Food was good, but nothing spectacular. The staff were great, attentive, kind, and had great recommendations. We had show tickets and even though we planned for plenty of time for dinner, at the end, we were rushing (our fault, we talked a lot and weren't paying attention to the time)  We asked our waiter to rush our dinner and bill and he accommodated without issues.

Such an awesome place.  Beautiful views and one of the best meals I have had Vegas! I ordered the filet and it was cooked perfectly. So juicy. The asparagus and mushrooms are also the best we have ever had. It is definitely pricey but worth it!!

VooDoo Steak was the best dining experience I had on my recent trip to Vegas. Service was 5-star plus. Here's what happened - we had made a reservation to enjoy a group dinner before the Penn & Teller show on Saturday night - only we mistakenly made the reservation for Friday night. When we showed up on Saturday, the hostesses never doubted us and they tried really hard to find our reservation.  They were super polite about it, no attitude whatsoever, but there was no reservation anywhere on their system. We checked our email, and there is was - for Friday, the night before! We had a fairly large party and it was a Saturday night and very crowded, so we were slightly panicked. The staff moved things around, did a little magic and pulled a rabbit out of a hat! They found us a great table with a view and up we went --- the glass elevator ride is part of the whole experience and once we were seated we still had plenty of time before the show to enjoy the excellent service, terrific cocktails (some of the best in Vegas!) and amazing food. Perfect steak! Sidebar-  its fun, though a bit unnerving for me, to watch brave people ride the zip line while you're eating. I highly recommend VooDoo Steak for a nice evening out, delicious food and amazing service. You should also definitely check out Penn & Teller while you're there, theshow is a blast!

Came here to have a quick drink before heading to the voodoo zip line. The IPAs were pretty limited. Well there was only one laginitas. Blah. But we still had one. Kenny our bartender recommended us going outside for the view. Glad he gave us the tip the view was amazing.

8:45 reservation for 4, many tables open however we were not seated until 9:20.  20 mins later we get our drinks after stopping a waitress to order them.  We then ordered our food and at 10:45 went to find the manager as we still did not have our food. It arrived shortly after. 2 of us order surf and turf ($80) and the lobster was dry and tough, and the filet was just ok.  3rd person  ordered seabass which made her sick.  4th order ribeye was good.
Sights of the city was the highlight.  Service was the worst I have ever had for such a fine dining restaurant.  Will not go back.

Great, fun, exclusive place for drinks and dinner. The Witch Doctor will that leave you standing you should share!!! It has 5 types of rum and it comes bubbling from the dry ice they put in it. Its a fun vegas size drink to take outside and enjoy the view. We sticked to appetizers which are generously portioned except for the beef Tartare which cannot be easily shared. The Fried Brie was good but i wished it was melted inside to make it easier to spread. The witch doctor seafood sampler is a lot of food with: crab cake, frog legs, hush puppies, and coconut shrimp. The coconut shrimp was the best. The frog legs were flavorless. Hush puppies great for muchin. The crab cake could use a bit more seasoning. The lobster bisque was delicious, creamy, full with flavor. The lobster bisque even came with a significant amount of lobster in it. Refills on the bisque was greatly desired.
Service was exceptional and fun.

If you are in to salt, salt and more salt, have had a lot to drink and need something to pull you down so you can start again or into paying Morton's prices for Sizzler quality, then this is the perfect stop for you.

The only thing Voodoo offers is good service.  As someone that was sober, enjoys a great quality steak, this was a bitter disappointment.  As for their veggie sides, stay away from the broccoli unless you want it as hard as it was delivered, you can't even call it al dente.  The mushrooms were laughable and drenched in salt.  Then we're onto the baked potato.  It is coated with sea salt, I mean coated.

So pay up to sober up, but if sober, I'd give it a pass and run to CraftSteak, Morton's or Charlie Palmers.

For our party of six;
Food was cooked perfectly and thoroughly enjoyed by everyone. Yes it's pricey but it's a premier Vegas steakhouse and you get what you pay for. The view is tremendous for fifty one stories up also! 

However the service left much to be desired. On a slow day, our server seemed to do the bare minimum and say as few words as possible. The back server was excellent though. 

In the end, very good place but besides the view, Ruth Chris is better in taste, price and service.

This delicious restaurant is located on the 50th floor of the Rio. The view was outstanding and service impeccable. All 3 of us had the French onion soup and filet. We were all raving about both of those items. I enjoyed the broccoli, but there was nothing special about it. The truffle Mac and cheese was a favorite of the other 2 guests in my party. After dinner, we walked outside to take pictures of the beautiful scenery. Great spot!

Party, party, party!!!
We were here to party for a friend's bday. Saw the reviews but hey, it was the best thing at Rio. Had over 20 of us so we really didn't want to complicate things migrating elsewhere for dinner. After all, after party was here at the hotel. 

Okkk. The food. Expected decent... Whatever food. That's what we got. Not going to elaborate too much bc there's really not much to tell. 
Everything is OOOOKKKKK! 
Ooooookkkkkk with a price tag that should be beeeeeetttttteeeeerrrr. 
Steaks and seafood were all on the dry side. 

Check out my photos. 
Food looks much better than it taste. Presentation was fab but I rather get something that looks like shizzz but tastes great. Just sayin...

Right outside the rooftop, they got that skyline zip thing. Handful in the group went. Think it was $30 a head. Two in a seat and you get zipped back and forth. The whole actual zip time was about a minute. 
An experience. 

Final thought...
If you are stuck here, this is probably the best restarant in the hotel. 
Came out to about $120/per. 
Personally, I rather go elsewhere paying the same for better food. Dahhhh!

AMAZING! The view was beautiful, the service stellar and the food was delectable! I had the lobster thermador. It was absolutely cooked to perfection. It was scrumptious! I would definitely go there again if visiting the Rio hotel! YUM!

It seems like I've been giving out five stars a lot lately, but this place totally earned it. I've been wanting to go there for years and we finally got around to it. Lots of people suggested that the steaks were amazing and the view was great and they weren't wrong. Sam was our very friendly and happy server, and we will ask for him every time we go from now on. We started out with the Caesar salad which we shared, and they were kind enough to split for us. My wife ordered the fillet mignon and I had the flank steak prepared au poivre, which they don't even offer on the menu for preparation, but the chef was nice enough to do it for me. They should put it on the menu! It was the best au poivre sauce I've ever had in my life! Our steaks were cooked absolutely perfectly. We enjoyed every bit of the experience, add some fantastic wine, I recommend the Ferrari Carano, and they even invited us out to the rooftop for some pictures and to take in the amazing view from the 50th floor of the Rio. Sam was also kind enough to remind us that as locals we were entitled to a 25% discount, unbelievable! Will be back for sure many times.

I can't speak to those other reviews where they were down on this place. Maybe it was just a chef having a bad day. But my experience was off the charts excellent! I had the 30 oz steak with the garlic crust and it was AWESOME. My buddy had the 20 oz ribeye, also excellent. He had the french onion soup and it was special as well.

Now, maybe it was because both of us are diamond players but the service, atmosphere and food were impeccable.

Thank you Karen (our wonderfully incredible hostess) for an amazing first night in Vegas!!!

Came here before seeing Penn/Teller (fantastic show...a must-see for sure!) and had one of the best experiences of our lives...  

The view was spectacular!  The service was over-the-top perfection!  The food was to die for!

That's a lot of superlatives but there are times when you come to Vegas and are ready to spend money for the "Vegas treatment" and are disappointed.  That was NOT the case here at Voodoo.  Everything here was just what we hoped for on our 1st night of our trip.  

She had the ménage e trois and I had a seared tuna special and their lobster bisque.  Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing!

...and just to top it off, we walked to the outside deck (incredible views.....incredibly scary looking zipline) and got to meet and get pictures with the just-crowned MMA champion Misha Tate who was there with friends, sporting her freshly minted belt!

Thanks again Karen!!!

My boyfriend took me here for a romantic date and that it was. I didn't know they had a steakhouse. It was seriously the best steak I have ever had. We also got whipped potatoes, Mac and cheese, and baby carrots all were very good. The view was amazing. The staff was great. I would definitely return.

My wife and I absolutely LOVE VooDoo!  It is our favorite bar/lounge and we just tried the steakhouse for the first time.  Fabulous giant cold seafood tray!  I am surprised this place isn't packed.  The views are just amazing.  It is so refreshing to step outside and feel the breeze on the 51st floor of Rio.  No cover!  We will be back in March.

Well lets start with the decor. In one word ugly, brown painted wall with a few wire voodoo figures, same old beat up chairs with stains on the fabric and wood that is all chewed up, I don't know who hired the designer , must have gone to home depot and asked for redecorating idea. There is nothing voodoo about it , the old decor was fun and different, this one is just different for the sake of not be the same but very badly done and done cheap. Then the setting, water stains on the silverware and bus boy that pour tap water into my glass with bottled water in it, I guess job training cost too much also. Then the food, well that is the tiniest and worse $48 fillet I have ever seen and the asparagus side dish was so tough and fibrous that only the first inch can be eaten, the rest would make a nice hammock cause it is tough enough to. My so call lobster thermidor was a total joke, I guess they decide what that is, no cognac in the sauce, no re bake in the shell with bread crumbs on top, and two tiny claw meat and the rest is crab!!!! This is the most pathetic Lobster Thermidor I have ever seen covered with a mystery salty sauce that have nothing to do with the dish other than to cover up the cheap ingredients. BTW in case they actually read this stuff at the RIO hotel, this is what Wikipedia's  definition of lobster is. Lobster Thermidor is a French dish consisting of a creamy mixture of cooked lobster meat, egg yolks, and cognac or brandy, stuffed into a lobster shell. It can also be served with an oven-browned cheese crust, typically Gruyère. The sauce must contain mustard.  Then after dinner got even worse, I left my cell phone there so I figure I call the restaurant to ask them to hold it for me. well the hotel computer only wanted to know if I want a room and when I got the operator, she send me to restaurant reservation , they send me back to operator and round and round it took all of 35 minutes...35 !!! then they tell me the restaurant is close and call security, security said call lost and found but they only open till 6 , on a Saturday in a casino they are open till 6!!!! I was more than disgusted with the entire system that have not the slightest notion of customer service in mind, they actually ask me to have my credit card ready when I was on hold for the operator.......this has turned into a low class , customer is just a walking credit card to them kind of a place. I will not be eating there, I will not be staying there and i most certainly will not be gambling there.

We made reservations here for a birthday celebration on a Sunday thinking that we might get better service as it's usually a slower night for restaurants. Boy, we're we right! We were seated 20 minutes later than our reserved time. Then waited 1 1/2 hours for our food. When asked to see the manager he came over and was the rudest person I've met in Vegas. When he asked what I wanted him to do I said nothing I just wanted to let you know for the rice and reputation we expected better service! He walked away and slammed the kitchen door. 

The manager should be fired! We were no way looking for comps or freebies.

Great atmosphere - we only had time for appetizer & soup but staff was very accommodating. French Onion soup was good but we all felt we had better. The lump crab & artichoke dip was outstanding. Definitely will make time for a full fining experience next time we're in Vegas.

I had been to the VooDoo Nightclub before, so I knew the view at VooDoo Steak would be wonderful.  The view was delightful.  Everything else was just okay...yet over-priced.  I am not a fan of overpaying for just okay food and a great view.

Go to VooDoo steak if you want a romantic or memorable dinner.  

The food is not bad...the average Joe may even appreciate it.  But the foodie in me was not impressed by anything we had.  I tried the Lobster Bisque, The Scallops, and the Sea Bass.  Of the three the Bisque was the best....with a nice touch of small apple bits mixed in with the lobster chunks on top.  The apple played nice with the sweet lobster bisque and even nicer with the lobster chunks.  Other than that nothing was memorable enough to warrant a return tasting.

This is a great place! Staff service was excellent. Lobster bisque was excellent. They even split our meals, we had ordered 2 of the filet, lobster and shrimp dinners and the portions and presentation was awesome ( served 4 of us ) we also had the oysters the best I have ever had so fresh!  We had bone in ribeye it had to be  over a pound, huge and excellent grill flavor and very tender. We also had a chicken pasta dish which we all loved. We added mushrooms for the table again very good. We started with a cocktail on the outside deck over looking the city awesome views!  We were party of 6 so tip was added at 18% automatically, well worth it we added a bit to it, the service was that good! It is a tad pricey but the food quality and the service was excellent would highly recommend for a special event !
Awesome view of vegas. Ribeye steak was great. Drinks were good and waiter was good. They took our picture or our group. Hit us up for $40 but hey it is vegas. We will definitely go there again.

Great view from almost every table.  The service was attentive.  Drinks were relatively strong, but were expensive.  They did seem to have a fair few decent wine-by-the-glass values.  I had a solid Australian Shiraz for $13.00.

The french onion soup was VERY average.  I was actually a little disappointed in it, as it is my favorite soup.  However, my friend had the lobster bisque and it was excellent.  Get it.  

I had a New York Strip from the standard side of the menu.  It was $46.00 with Rewards Card discount.  The cut was really good and thick.  I ordered it medium-rare, but it was almost medium.  The flavor and tenderness were average.  

For Vegas, a steak dinner will set you back and, in some cases, rip you off.  I felt the Voodoo was just right for the price.  Above average view, with average prices and decent steaks.  Make reservations.
