Reservations were time consuming and just tried to get sales information for rewards card.  Food was decent but a little tough on the Tomahawk cut.  However, at end, the water boy threw away wife's food we asked to be boxed.  As we waited for replacement it was clear we were being ignored so we left.

Food and view are incredible. Service was good, our waiter was attentive and knew the menu. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is the bartender and other wait staff were talking and laughing loudly while watching a video on their phone in the middle of the restaurant, very unprofessional.

Amazing views of the strip from 50 floors on top of the Rio.  The Rio is off the beaten path and showing it's age but this restaurant and bar held up well.  Stopped here for dinner before seeing Penn and Teller one night this week. Was not as expensive as some of the strip hotels and the food was better than I expected.  Service was top notch.  You can walk out onto the roof bar and see all around the tower - great views!  They also have a zip line between the towers, fun to watch but be warned they shoot you over and then have to pull you back, two rides for the price of one!  Anyway, food was good, prices were good and services was stunning - worth taking a trip off the strip to visit the Rio while you're in town.

Went to VooDoo Steak for my birthday because we were staying at the Rio, got a small discount because we were part of the Total Rewards program at the hotel.  When I made the reservation on Open Table, I told them that it was my birthday and that we wanted a table on the window, which we got, but not the best view of the strip.  We both had a chance to get up and walk around the restaurant and saw at least three open tables on the window with an amazing view of the Strip, kind of disappointed about not getting one of those tables.  Other than that, the food was great, the Lobster Bisque was AMAZING, we both got the Voodoo Menage a Trios (fillet, lobster tail & shrimp) which was also delicious. They brought me cake with a candle for my birthday, service was good as well.  

After, we went up to the Voodoo Rooftop Lounge, was nice that we didn't have to pay a cover because we had just had dinner.  Views were awesome, music was good and the crowd was right around our age which was nice since we are not 20 or 30 somethings!

I should have known better that when I walked in on a Saturday night the place was dead, except for a table of 8 with a loud mouth at the helm making sure  the entire restaurant heard his conversations.

Let's start off and say the place is overpriced, and has sub par food. Service was OK, had to return a portion of my wife's steak as it was bland and did not taste right. The waiter was clearly trying to do his job by apologizing and offer a replacement dish, but the damage was done and killed her appetite.

The only savior of the night was a  good bottle of wine along with my wife by my side. Also the view of the strip was very nice.

Save your money as there are better places to eat steak in Vegas. Being a betting man, I would bet this place will not be around too much longer.

Service was great... "Candle light" dinner was a small votive on the table. Ordered the ménage a trios -filet, shrimp and lobster. Food was cold... Favor mediocre...very disappointed considering how much we paid. Husband faired a little better, ordered the special. At least his food was warm. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

More like 4.8 stars. The ambience was great with an amazing view. The Australian Waygu ribeye was cooked to perfection and melting in the mouth. Worth the $$. Sides were ok, but too big and a bit overpriced. The food took long time to come out.

Gave it a 5 stars because of price and view! Killer view and price for a steakhouse in Vegas is excellent. Service was excellent, food was great, drinks were good and not terribly overpriced. Highly recommend lobster bisque! Scallops and Steak were on point as well. Love that while the food is cooking we could go out on patio and do the zipline.

Over priced food, nothing special. All the sides suck. 

I ordered the NY strip steak which was huge and delightful. My boyfriend ordered the $70 Waygu ribeye and it was horrid! All of the sides we ordered were extremely plain. I could cook it with more flavor with my eyes closed. Its supposed to be the best restaurant in the Rio but honestly there was nothing that stuck out except the high prices.
Three star restaurant.  We split a dinner and lobster bisque.  It was okay.  The wait staff hovered then disappeared. I like the restaurant at Harrahs Las Vegas better.

Dinner for three at the Voodoo steak in the Rio Hotel. . Waiter was amazing. We all had a fillets, salad and sides. Salad was good, as were the baked potatoes and Mac and cheese. The disappointing part of our meal were the steaks. They arrived on a big white plate with a couple Brussel  sprouts.  My small filet looked lost. No bother, I was hungry. The steak ordered med. rare was overcooked and absolutely tasteless. It was not charred, or juicy.  Just a bland, no color, no taste steak. I was really disappointed, and when we got  the check for just over $300, I decided they needed A review on yelp. We usually eat at the All American downstairs in the Rio, and will go there from now on. They have great steaks!  The Voodoo has the view of Las Vegas, and the atmosphere we all want, but I give them only one star for the steak. The waiter on the other hand, was five star excellent. Try the steak house downstairs.

Went here for dinner and primarily to catch the view on rooftop.  The food was competently prepared and my rib-eye was good.  The service was bad, the waiter forgot simple utensils, and after waiting 5 minutes for him to bring me a spoon, I had to ask someone else.  Btw, the place was not very busy.  Food was expensive so I had hoped for better.  I had a much better steak dinner at "Mon Ami Gabi" for far less money than I spent here.

I went to  VooDoo Steak with 3 others. It was a Wednesday evening (around 7) and the place was relatively empty. But, we were told that to sit at a window, we would have to each spend a minimum of $100. [This really isn't hard to do with their inflated prices--we actually spent a bit over $400 for the four of us.] What disturbed me was that everyone dining there could have been seated at a window table but instead they insisted on this antiquated and insulting practice. The food was adequate, nothing more. You have to read the menu with the server's flashlight which was also annoying. All in all, one star is more than adequate.
This place is a for sure must hit while your in Vegas. Best F-n food anytime night or day. Thanks for the best service ever. Will be back for sure.

Omg.. the filet was absolutely incredible! I've never had a steak so tender and didn't even need to add salt.. so so delicious!! My bf had the lamb and that was so tender and flavorful. But what made the night even better was our incredible server Jacinto.. he had a great attitude and even better server skills. What a wonderful experience!! Definitely recommend you go here!!

Awesome view and you can see all the zip liners going off the side of the building.  The drinks are fancy and have dry ice to make them smoke.  We were there for a business dinner and the atmosphere is perfect and not too noisy.
It was really good. Great service. Pricy but worth it. Can't wait to come back some time soon! Had the 14 oz flat iron and the flavor was just perfect.

On the 50th floor with amazing views of the whole city ! I've been here once before but appreciated it much more this time, the ride up in the open elevator was great. Greeted by our hostess we were seated at the window with a great view just at sunset as we we're eating before the show. We made reservations on the open table app and it was super easy. 

I ordered a nice Malbec and my sister a Merlot. Our waiter was very helpful and informative about the menu. Good size restaurant, with a nice size bar and a very good wine list. 

I had 1/2 dozen oysters and they were on the small side but very nice. (My apologies can not remember where they were from). Came with horseradish, lemon and seafood sauce. Not the toppings I would have preferred, however it was very tasty, and 10 out of 10 on that choice, My sister ordered the onion soup. It was very cheesy, lots of onions and was made with a nice beef broth, also delicious. There were about 10 appetizers on the menu and it was a tough call which to order, they all sounded great. 

Bread basket of LOTS of assorted warm rolls arrived with a great deal of butter arrived at the table and I hate to admit it, but I tried a couple - yummy, they were good! 

Great menu selection and it was hard to choose, but for my entree I had a 8 oz filet with a side of creamed spinach, it was rare, just the way I ordered it and it melted in your mouth it was soooooo good. My sister ordered the "Trio"; steak, lobster and prawns. The steak was a nice 4oz, the lobster was a nice size, but the "prawns" looked like shrimp....they were certainly on the small side, she received two and I was lucky enough to get one. Very delicious and buttery tasting, even though they were on the small side.  It came with potato and vegetables and they were kind enough to eliminate the potato and add some more vegetables. 

For dessert sis had the creme brûlée and said it was just great, I did manage to get my spoon in there and taste it, and yummy was that good! 

We received our discount using total rewards which was outstanding, and my great sister picked up the tab! It is a very pricy menu and the majority of entrees come a la carte. 

All in all, service was great, food just wonderful and view from the top was stellar!!!! Even got to hop out on to the patio and it was really nice, small breeze and perfect for some photos of the city.

Go elsewhere. The Rio is not exactly known for their food and this is no exception, but will set you back at least $50. 

Here are the issues.

The host didn't get our jokes. She was kind of a stick in the mud. 

There is a holding area for the elevator. There was literally what looked like a gurney for moving people around and weird "voodoo" like decorations on the walls. We got in the elevator of horrors, which was not air conditioned. The view outside was great, but not at 140 F. 

When we got into the restaurant, there was a weird lion/leopard/Africa them to the chairs, but a decidedly French/American menu. We had a nice view.

Our server forgot my order of truffle mac and cheese and there weren't really truffles in it (they faked out on me when they finally brought it). My lobster bisque had a skin on it by the time it came out, my sidecar was average.

One saving grace was the basket of bread brought out. It had the parmesan flat crisps and they were quite good. 

We were also charged for water. Tap water.

If you want a view, hit this up at night for the club. It seems better suited to that than as a restaurant.

Ok, more like 3.8 stars. I ordered seafood at a steakhouse so that was probably my mistake. :-( My boyfriend and our other friend both ordered steaks and were in loooove. They tasted pretty good! I just wasn't in the mood for a slab of meat.

I ordered a lobster pasta, and it was just.. bland and a little disappointing for the price that I was paying. It wasn't bad, it just didn't taste amazing either. Some of the lobster pieces were overcooked and rubbery feeling. The pasta itself had little to no flavor... Again, my mistake for ordering seafood at a steakhouse.

The view though --- gorgeous panoramic views of the strip. They have a patio area that you can go out to and just enjoy the view, take some pictures, and hang out with your drinks. That was probably the best part about dining here. 

Our server was also great and very friendly. He was quick to get us the things we needed and to correct any mistakes. He brought out the wrong side dish for my friend, and quickly remedied the problem (and let us keep the extra dish at no charge). The filet mignon that my friends ordered were yummy from what I could tell, and they were super satisfied with their meal.
A near perfect meal. Our waiter was a bit of a jerk. The food and the chefs were great.

Wow, I just realized that I have never gotten around to reviewing Voodoo.  How could I have done that when Voodoo is one of our favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas, and has been since even before we moved here in 2015?  My bad!  My wife and I have been here several times, and we have never been disappointed.

At a steakhouse, I tend to go straight for the steaks - usually the rib eye or the filet.  Each of these cuts has its own bugaboo at high end steakhouses - sometimes the rib eye has too much fat and gristle in the cap, and sometimes the filet has a nice sear but the texture is a little bit mealy.  Neither or these problems has ever reared its ugly head at Voodoo.  Meanwhile, my wife tends to order seafood, and she has always raved about her meals at Voodoo.  I notice that the one recurring problem that tends to pop up in most of the negative reviews here are about the halibut being overcooked.  Neither of us has ever ordered the halibut that I recall, but there sure are plenty of other choices that are first rate.

Now that Alize has closed its doors, I think Voodoo has the best view of any restaurant in Vegas.  Not only is the view fabulous from every table, but you can also take a quick stroll out on the deck between courses and enjoy the panoramic view from there as well.  I have also been pleased with the service every time; I can't recall ever having had a problem.

The fact that the Rio is a little bit off the Strip not only contributes to the view, it also makes it easy to get here (at least if you're a local like me, and are driving).  Prices are definitely high end, but not off the charts.  And, unlike the restaurants at most Caesar's properties, the online menu here actually lists prices.  (Menus that don't list prices are a pet peeve of mine, so I appreciate that.)  So, with the great food, great view, and great location, Voodoo is a perfect place for a celebration event, or just a high end dinner.

I have been too VooDoo a few times and the experience has been nothing but positive. For a Steakhouse in Las Vegas, it is not badly priced. The wait staff has been nothing but friendly. My steak, which I like medium rare, has been cooked to perfection every time. The nightclub above adds a great atmosphere the restaurant along with the amazing view of The Strip. As a local, I have recommend this place to many friends visiting.

The steak tartar here was some of the best I've had in the last year. Great presentation, wonderful flavor.

My filet with garlic and horseradish mash was served exactly as I ordered it, rare. The macaroni and cheese was rich. The vegetables were cooked nicely, flavorful, and not overdone. Overall, this was an excellent meal in a sophisticated atmosphere. My dinner companions and I had a lovely evening.

The wine selection was good, though a touch pricey as compared to other places, but to be expected.

Service was genial, prompt, and detail oriented.

Meh. Just... meh. There's better and there's worse. The cow isn't bad, it just isn't "exciting".

Pedestrian wine list and marginal service. What else could you ask for?
Been here many times. Never disappoints. Great food with excellent service! The view is amazing!

No stars.. We just walked out. Terrible service. Different menu than online by like 10-15$.. Just not very good. 
Have to give discount ticket to EVERYONE before even ordering.. Suspious... 
Probably never do back

Showed up at Voodoo Steak for my birthday dinner. Imagine my chagrin when I found out I'd made the reservation for another day. Well the hostess was cool enough to find a table for my party even on a busy night. When then had a delicious dinner with great service. Special praise for Jamal our server.  The filet mignon was delicious. We left happy and smiling. Full marks.

So the main thing that this restaurant has going for them is the panoramic views of the city. The view is absolutely exquisite. Sadly that is where the selling point of this restaurant begins and ends.

I will make this short and sweet. 
I understand we technically got there when the restaurant was closing but they still decided to seat us even though they initially turned us away but since we were a large party I guess they saw dollar signs. 

Our server seemed annoyed by our presence and barely checked on us during the meal. For the prices of the meal I expect to receive 5 star service and it was more like 1 star. I've had better service at Chilli's. All the food i ordered was just ok nothing out of this world and definitely does not match the prices that go with it.

Please be aware that if you dine here you are basically paying for the view above anything else. The upside there is a rooftop lounge above the restaurant, which seemed to be playing pretty good music.

This place was great on all of the above, service, food, and atmosphere. The view is phenomenal. They have a patio that you can walk out on and have a drink, take pictures, check out the view etc. 

The waiter we had was lovely! Very attentive and friendly! I had the French onion soup, filet, and we split two sides Mac n cheese and the broccoli. Everything was wonderful! French onion soup was my favorite I loved the peppercorn taste it had. Broccoli was just that, broccoli but nothing to complain about. My steak was cooked perfect and we couldn't stop eating the Mac n cheese! 

I will go back next time I'm in Vegas!

We arrived with a 5:45 reservation but could not sit by the window due to staffing. The view is the point of this place. Our booth had the most annoying light overhead that killed the ambience. Food was so overpriced. Ordered a Caesar salad that was mediocre at best. Steak just ok. When they  bussed the table they stacked every plate on top of each other, on the table in front of us. Gross! Then left all the crumbs and never came back. Two people, $175 with one beer and one glass of wine. Shared a steak. Fine dining price with Appleby's service!! Will NEVER go back. I do not recommend this place-save your money.

Located on 50th floor at the Rio so the view is amazing. Steak was great, asparagus was great but mashed potatoes were bland, mac and cheese also not impressive at all. It's so confusing why they would serve both these sides that are so bad. The owner would be so mad if he cared or tasted these mashed potatoes which seemed like bad baby food. Steak was proper but I couldn't even finish the sides even though they were tiny servings. I'll be back to try again because I have several friends that like this place so I'll update later. Enjoy
Nice restaurant with a awesome view. Steak was cooked perfect and service was very good. Very pricey but we knew that ahead of time.

In summary the best way to describe this restaurant is mediocre @ best, and I am not one to celebrate mediocraxy ;(  

The food here was just okay - we ordered the spinach salad, lobster bisque, 12 oz fillet, lamb chops, side of mushrooms, and the duo chocolate Carmel bomb cake.

I would not recommend the spinach salad ... Olive gardens salad is waaaay better!  The lobster bisque was very good, but it fell well short of being great or excellent.  The portion size of the lamb chops were amazing, probably the largest portion of lamb that I have ever seen, but one was of the chops was overcooked, plus they were bland - thank god for the mushrooms and the dipping sauce on the side!! The filet was just alright ... I have had both better and worse.  The mushrooms were probably the best lol

The service was just so-so ... It wasn't amazing, but not horrible.

The price is very high for mediocre food, service, ambiance ... The view is nice, but there is plenty of restaurants with nice views in Vegas.  

I do not know that I would ever return here or recommend anyone here ... It was too "average" for the excessive cost.
Excellent food and service. The view is amazing. It was a great place to spend our 10 year Anniversary.

Below average steak. Tempura green beans were awful. The only redeeming thing was the asparagus. For $105 I expected way better. Bonus: getting to watch four Vietnamese guys pour A1 sauce all over everything and group eat 3 steaks. 

Never again.

Most of the other reviews are pretty accurate.
cons:
The price doesnt match the food quality. 
The prices on the link to the menu, dont match the actual prices. Its around $10 more. The servers are a little rude.

Pros: 
The view from the 50th floor
rib-eye was pretty good

Totally overated. I've tried this place twice now and doubt I'll be back. The service is TERRIBLE I truly cannot stress that enough. The servers disappear forever. We were constantly out of water, had to wait for almost 40 minutes to get our drinks.  The food took almost 2 hours to get to our table from the time we first arrived. The food was good but over priced. And my boyfriend became quite ill after having the lobster on our second visit.

made the reservation for our last night at Las Vegas, got there early, dressed and waited an hour at the Casino only to find that the elevator has technical difficulty and the restaurant won't be able to serve us. of all these time I am waiting, not a single phone call from them notifying us, and what they can offer in return is 10% off at their American bar and grill? forget it, I am not coming back, my time is much more worthy than that. I spent half an hour going to planet Hollywood for their buffet and another hour waiting in line, over dressed and was starving by the time seated, fortunately the spice market buffet didn't disappoint me and made my last night at Las Vegas a total nightmare.

Apparently the air conditioning was out as there were several fans placed around the dining room.  The steaks were well cooked, but were not the quality cuts you would expect for $60. The service was adequate but again, the overall experience was not what you would expect for the prices they charge. And I don't expect a roving photographer trying to sell me $40 photos. 
If you have anywhere to be after your meal give yourself plenty of time.  It took nearly an hour to get our meal, with a mostly empty restaurant. 
Overall very disappointed. Ruths Chris deserves your money way more than Voodoo Steakhouse.

Our waiter was great! Jamal. Impeccable service and really decent food. It's a bit pricey but quality seemed good. My girl had crab legs and filet  and I had a  ribeye. We shared a side and a lobster bisk. Like I said pricey however, locals and rewards members may be eligible for a discount so ask. Waiter was personable and I hope he's there my next time. Food good quality.... Portions ok, sides ok, & view is great as its on the roof. Good occasion spot!

For the prices you would think the quality of food would be at least decent. Had a large party and ordered many things. EVERYTHING on the menu was bland. The popular dishes like the lobster bisque, was just plain salty. The mac&cheese looks great, but taste like hard noodles in a queso. The shrimp had no seasoning at all. Great view,, but there are other restaurants in the area with a great view and much better food!

Came here for a late dinner. Ordered the tomahawk. It was really good. It's so huge I had to share it with a friend and we still had trouble finishing it. The service was very attentive. The view was awesome as well.

We ate at the VooDoo Steakhouse last night, on the last night of our honeymoon. It was an outstanding experience, with incredible food, stunning views, and impeccable service. 

We were seated on the strip side of the restaurant, and could see the entire Las Vegas strip lit up and sparkling. Our waiter, Jamal, was attentive, kind, and professional, making the entire experience magical. I had the diver scallops, and my husband had the filet. The scallops were excellent, and the filet was exceptional - buttery tender with great flavor. We shared the Voodoo truffle fries, which were also amazing. We each had a martini, and then I asked for a glass of wine with dinner - it appeared the second the food was delivered, again like magic. 

While not cheap, this was definitely an experience worth every penny. If we're in Vegas again, we'll be back.

Crab & Artichoke dip - 10
New York Steak - 10
Mac & Cheese with Truffle Oil - 10
View - 10

This is an amazing place. Bring your Rewards Card and if you know someone who works at a Vegas hotel - discounts!

As a local that has dinned at the Voodoo Steakhouse for all our special occasions, I come to learn after making reservations to take my fiancée this year for his birthday they decided to charge $100 PER PERSON to have a window seat. We have dinned there plenty of times.  I will never go back to pay $100 for a window seat that used to be NO CHARGE. VERY DISAPPOINTED

We had a late dinner here on December 30, 2012. We had just drove into Vegas to spend NYE here. We were tired and didn't want to to go anywhere else after a 7 hour drive, so since we were staying at the Rio, we tried the steakhouse. All I got to say is that it was amazing. We enjoyed the food and drinks. Everything was awesome. The best part of all, you get to go up the stairs inside the steakhouse and into the night club on the roof for free.
Pricey but worth it! Excellent food and service! Overlooks the strip and clean upscale restaurant...would definitely go back! Out of the four of us no one had complaints...

Very disappointed.  Only reason I didn't give Voodoo Steakhouse zero stars is because it has a nice view.  First I ordered a Heineken in a glass.  The glass was not frosty and the Heineken was so skunky that it tasted like it was in storage for months...couldn't drink it.  Then the bread came out.  Nice butter, but bread could cut glass.  No doubt the bread was sitting out all day (2days?).  I ordered the 10oz fillet mignon with demiglaze and asked for 'extra sauce on the side', medium-rare with the truffled macc and cheese, and broccoli with garlic and oil for my two sides.  Meal came out without any sauce on the side and barely any on the meat.  I asked for my side of sauce and they brought out an amount that still wasnt enough for the whole steak.....I gave up on the sauce. Meat was dry and overcooked which is a huge negative for a steakhouse.  The macc and cheese could have been from any mediocre buffet and the broccoli was practically raw.....way too crunchy and tough.    Now it's 2 hours after eating and I don't feel 100%.....a little stomach uneasiness.  I wanted to express my thoughts to the waiter but does that really do anything other than make me look like a jerk?  So I paid my almost $90 bill with a smile....but will not be going back.

Food good. Drinks, meh.

My friend and I split a seafood platter to start, then a fresh tomato salad with burata aged balsamic, and finished with a tomahawk steak.

The seafood platter was fresh. Lobster, crab, shrimp, oyster. Delicious. 

Salad: amazing. Burata cheese was outstanding. Tomatoes are decent. Wish they would have used farmer market quality, but the quality of the balsamic burata and fresh salad well made up for it.

Tomahawk steak cooked rare: delicious! Perfectly cooked! 

The drinks were meh. My friend had a old fashion then a Manhattan. Both were too sweet for his taste.

Overall amazing view. Food is great. Service excellent. Drinks, there are better places to go on the strip.

I started with the lobster bisque, which had a bit of a unexpected kick, though not great as I look for more creaminess over spice in my bisque.  Apart from the tower view, the aged flavorful cajun rib-eye -- probably the fattiest peice of meat I've ever had was the main reason to dine here.  It was so fatty that I had to cut out some of the thicker marbles which made up almost a fifth of my steak, but every bite was packed with that rich, meaty flavor which I love.   The sides appetizers and desserts were just standard fare.

We came here on a weeknight with a groupon and figured we may as well give it a shot since we were in this part of town already. The first thing to comment on is the view-- it really is gorgeous and adds to the allure and fun of dining at a place like this. If you and your significant other are both into steaks, I think this place is a great choice just on that basis alone. It offers a refreshing atmosphere that really seems to take you away from the mundane activities of daily life. But I digress..

Service is good here. The hostess didn't glare when she saw our groupon and I appreciate this seemingly small fact. The waiter had a fair understanding of the menu and offered a number of suggestions based on our preferences and experiences with previous steak houses. Cheaping out, we neglected to order an appetizer and went straight for the main course.

My girlfriend ordered a veal with pasta dish. I don't recall the name, but it was respectably good. The pasta was light and had the distinct flavor of sauteed shallots throughout it, and I am certain it was cooked with a certain amount of wine. The veal was incredibly tender--probably the softest I have ever had at a restaurant. What sets this place apart is the quality of the meat; the waiter was sure to point out how very particular this establishment is about the meat here and where they get it from.

I decided to order something from their prime section, which includes a delicious looking wagyu cut that I will have to try next time. I instead opted for a 14 oz flat iron. I rarely order flat irons simply because most restaurants don't even offer them. Only a high quality cut is worthy of being served at the fine dining level. 

After much thought and internal conflict, I chose the Truffle Mac n' Cheese as my side.
It was incredibly rich, and full of flavor. Not like the stuff you can get at Lucille's barbecue, as this offering had a much more distinct taste. However, it was every bit as good, if not just a bit different. You can really appreciate the different cheeses in it with each bite, but like I said it's really heavy. I wanted to finish my steak so I decided only to eat half of it and saved the rest for an enjoyable leftovers session.

The steak itself was impressive. I was not expecting to enjoy a cut like flat iron because it is categorized below rib eye and new york in terms of quality. However, because it was prime beef I really was able to enjoy its flavor and thick consistency. It doesn't have some of the same marbling that you'll get in a filet mignon but in a way it is more enjoyable and it was prepared perfectly here. I gobbled it up without difficulty. 

I can't say I'll be returning here soon because I just don't have that sort of money, but suffice it to say that I'll bookmark this place as a good spot for a celebration if I am still in Vegas years down the line.

Voodoo steak has an amazing location. Atop the Rio is has a great view of the strip at night. Order some drinks, then apps and wait for your entrees to come out on the balcony with your glass of cab. 

Lobster bisque, Foie gras app, seafood platter, 18oz steak, and sea bass were all very good. Compliments to the chef!

The ambiance and views were great, and so was the roof deck access (free if you eat here).  The service was great too.  The food, on the other hand, was so-so IMHO.  I got the sea scallops, which were way over flavored, and the lobster bisque was unmemorable.  Nobody at my table raved about the food, but nobody complained either.  Food quantity was more then adequate for a "fancy restaurant".  Prices were too high, IMHO.  At least that meant there were no crowds even though the Rio was completely sold out for a conference.  Definitely pick up a free Total Rewards card from the casino level on your way in and you'll save a bit.  The place was very convenient for us since we were staying at the Rio.  So I'd count the meal as a success.  But I wouldn't come here as a destination.
This is an outstanding place to have dinner. The food is great. Although the steak is fabulous the scallops are incredible. And the view from the balcony is incredible.

YUM YUM YUM!!!  Terrific!  We had reservations and they were expecting us when we arrived, gave last name and they didn't even look down at the book, called upstairs and announced my full name for them to be ready for us.  Very cool.  We ordered the Trio of Filet, Lobster Tail, and Shrimp.  My husband and I each have had Gastric Bypass so we always share and they split the meal for us.  The filet, cooked perfectly rare.  The lobster was a terrific amount of meat.  The shrimp were large and good.  Beautiful presentation on the plate with small amount of mashed potatoes, baby carrot, lemon wedge.  We also tried the bone marrow.  Excellent.  Always wonder why they make it so salty though?  Every restaurant, not just this one.  We also ordered mashed potatoes not knowing we'd have them on the other plate so unfortunately we spent a bit too much with that order.  We had the shishito peppers which were great.  As an appetizer we split the wedge salad - again, absolutely delicious!  After, we went out to the rooftop bar lounge area.  Great view of the strip!  Anyways... didn't have a high expectations of the Rio in general, but we had a great meal experience, the Penn and Teller show was awesome, and we had fun gambling.  We'd go back!

My bf ordered the 32oz Tomahawk ($79) and I ordered the 8 oz filet mignon ($47). Alongside our truffle Mac and cheese and asparagus. I usually don't eat all my food but when it is so good, everything is literally licked off my plate. The only steakhouse I've been to in LV and is now my fave. If you have a Total Rewards card you get $2 off each. To add to this review, we had a party of 11. Service was great.  Our bill was approx. $900. Be sure to have cash if you're splitting the bill.

The view from the terrace is nice. From the tables in the restaurant however they a bland. The drinks were serviceable. I had a margarita and my wife had a mojito. Neither could be made to order. I wanted blended but was told rocks only. My wife wanted a pomegranate mojito like she'd had downstairs. Nope, no pomegranate. The onion soup was delicious. Not too salty. The bone-in ribeye needed something. Can't put my finger on it but the flavor wasn't there. Same for my wife's halibut. For $250 for a dinner for two I've had a lot better. The table was a little dirty/sticky. The chairs were mismatched. Just all in all an expensive so-so meal. Can't recommend.

What a great restaurant, there's a great view of the full Las Vegas strip and the service was awesome too! I got the Maine lobster with crab meat on top, it was amazing! And the truffle Mac and cheese is one of the top give Mac and cheeses I've ever had. I will definitely have to return next time I'm in Vegas!

I took my sons here for Mothers Day/sons 21st birthday. We were going to have dinner, go to the club, and make it an unforgettable experience. Unfortunately, 2 out of 4 of us became I'll after eating the seafood. My youngest son and I had the steak, which was delicious! No complaints there. One son had the scallops and the other had the sea bass. One was throwing up at the restaurant and the other hours later. I called to report the incident to the restaurant. They took some notes and that was it. No offer of compensation, an apology to me...nothing. As a matter of fact, I had to keep calling  the restaurant just to get a hold of anyone to make the report! I did fill out the hotel survey afterwards and still, crickets...
Overall, poor customer service, lack of follow up and seafood is obviously not their forte.
After having spent $400 on a meal, I would expect a lot more on the service side from the management.

Great view and decent service and food.  A bit cheaper than the other prime steakhouses in Las Vegas.

We ate at Voodoo after the Rat Pack show, so we just ordered appetizers for our meal.  Started with the Steak Tartare -- good, but a bit too much truffle oil.  Braised short ribs were great.  Foie gras plate was well done.

Decent wine selection, a bit cheaper than Prime or Delmonicos, with some nice mid-price bottles.  Waiter wasn't particularly knowledgeable about the wine selections and didn't offer to send over a wine steward or sommelier.  We knew what we were looking for & selected for ourselves; but if we would have needed help, we would have been stranded.

Probably won't go back, but we don't go to The Rio.  So, I wouldn't take a taxi to get there.

Every time my girlfriend and I are in Vegas, we make it a point to go to the VooDoo Steakhouse.  Not only does it offer amazing views of the city, the food and service are superb!  We were fortunate to have Samuel and Nasto serve us.  They are great - ask for them!  Sam makes each experience special and meaningful.  We first had Sam serve us two years ago.  It is great he is still there; we appreciate his attention to detail and polite, professional - yet personal mannerisms.)  

We've not had a bad meal yet - and we enjoy visiting fine dining establishments all across the country.  After each meal, we enjoy a few glasses of wine out on the rooftop patio.  On a nice evening, it doesn't get much more relaxing!

Unfortunately, our last visit was on the awful night of October 1, 2017.  As the horror rang out just blocks away, we were finishing our dessert and were headed to the rooftop patio with our drinks.  The staff were amazing by informing us of what was happening (apparently someone had a police scanner there - very helpful and highly recommended).  We eventually had to be evacuated from the roof for security concerns.  The staff could not have been more kind, courteous and concerned for our safety.  Thank you to everyone.  Our thoughts and prayers remain with that city and its people!

amazing steakhouse at the top of the rio where there is a nightclub with a gorgeous view of the strip. 

Get the bone in Rib Eye (my favorite cut of steak and best thing there) and a side of mac and cheese. 

steaks are about $60 but worth it
Jose from Nevada was very warm with us. He was very polite and very good in service. Keep up the good work Jose! Thank you for the awesome service!

The views are amazing first off. The food was very good. The crab and artichoke dip was delicious. I got the 20 oz steak and it was cooked to perfection. Our waiter was very friendly. The atmosphere here is cool and you get free admission to the rooftop lounge which has amazing views. Check this place out if you are in Vegas.

Spectacular view and excellent service. Everyone had steak they were happy with. Wedge salad was less than excellent. The beef was of very good quality but not quite to the standards of say The Capital Grill. Bar service was outstanding with a generous poor. Very good selection of bourbon. Overall a good value with a professional service staff. Worth the visit.
During our last visit to Vegas we decided to try a different steak house. We didn't realize the view from the 50th floor would be so gorgeous. The steaks were delicious. Definitely worth trying once.

Came here with high expectations, left disappointed. 
Filet mignon was a bit dry and not as soft as I wished; the mixed drinks left much to be desired especially the super expensive witch doctor which just tastes like extremely sweetened cough syrup. 
Giving it two stars because the waiter was nice, the salmon my wife had was pretty good and so was the truffle mac n cheese. The bone marrow was okay.

Come here with my boyfriend for a late dinner. We were impressed by the view. Our server was nice (I think his name was John) . However I won't be coming back. The plate they brought me for the complimentary bread was dirty. The plate they brought me for the appetizer was also dirty. I didn't really think our appetizer was that good (fried Brie) but my boyfriend said he loved it. Maybe I was just too preoccupied with the dirty plates.... I got a filet, I think it was 12 oz and my boyfriend got the dry aged bone in rib eye. Both of our steaks were undercooked. I had ordered medium and he ordered medwell. I am fine with a medium rare or even a rare steak... that's just not what I ordered tonight. But since I enjoy rare-medrare steaks just as much as medium ones I decided to eat it anyway. That steak practically melted in my mouth. It was sooooo good. I tried a bit of my boyfriends steak and was surprised at how different the flavor was. It was really good too. We also had a baked potato (kinda hard to screw that up) and the truffle Mac and cheese as our sides and they were both acceptable. 

The food was good but the only thing that really wow'ed me was the steak, and for $200.... I expect everything about my experience to wow me. I especially expect all of my plates to be clean. That took my rating down a star. Not worth the money in my book

Oh so my first time here and I was starving upon arrival so I ordered the platter for app and raw filet mignon with quail egg... The platter consisted of fried frog legs, a big crab cake in center, friend shrimp and scallops (I think) it was soo much but I was hungry so as a entree I ordered stuffed lobster which I did not eat all but it was good, I was really stuffed, I can't do all the fried food, it irritates my stomach so the platter wasn't a good choice but if was not nasty, quite good.. I went Luton the rooftop where the view was beautiful and they had a zip line there which I didn't get on due to dear if heights but my tummy was satisfied but def over priced in a way

We were there on July 5, 2017.. This was our first time visiting the Steakhouse..We had reservations but we arrived early, and went to the bar for a drink.. The first thing we noticed was the restaurant was very warm and they had fans to take the edge off. The bartender was very friendly and advised us that they could sit us whenever we were ready.. He recommended walking out onto the rooftop for the views..
Once we were seated the waiters were very attentive and helpful with the menu selections..
We ordered to share the lobster Mac and cheese, and we both ordered the filet.  The lobster Mac and cheese had no flavour of cheese and only tiny pieces of lobster. Our steak were not juicy and also no flavour.. I must say we were both disappointed with the food, but the service was excellent...
Service was phenomenal!! View of the Las Vegas Strip was stunning. Perfect way to end our trip :) pricey but you get what you pay more.

Like so many before us, the view is killer. And being a Diamond Player assures us a window table each time. As a bonus, the evening we dined,  the outdoor patio deck was the perfect temperature wind no wind whatsoever. 

My wife and I ordered the lump crab and artichoke dip with boursin cheese, pita chips (was very tasty and loads of crab) and I just had to have the seared foie gras which was seared to absolute perfection, beautiful in texture with that buttery rich flavor I so miss since California, the nanny state has outlawed foie gras. making it easier to score crack cocaine on a Saturday night out.

My wife had a glass of wine which she stated was very good, sorry, I forgot the brand but believe it was Ferrari-Carano Merlot and although our families favorite is their Cabernet Sauvignon, it has been impossible to find the Ferrari-Carano Cabernet Sauvignon lately. 

We ordered the ménage a tois, a filet mignon, lobster tail and shrimp for our main course and were not disappointed. The steak was cooked perfectly to a medium rare, and the lobster tail was sweet and delicious. The shrimp were large in size and equally delicious with a sweet aftertaste. We also ordered their truffle mac and cheese and it really was rather delicious! The broccoli sauteed in olive and garlic oil was very good and cooked to our liking.

Our waiter, Jose was spot on, attentive with a healthy sense of humor and seemed to go out of his way to please not only us, but the other guests in his station. The timing of the meal was not rushed and each course arrived in perfect timing.

I did not find the bill exorbitant for the experience and quality of food and a quick scan of the dining room proved that there certainly everyone was having a good time. We will return again and again for sure.

As a side note, in the past we have enjoyed a most incredible New Years Eve party here on the 50th floor of the VooDoo Steakhouse and Lounge, one my family constantly remembers as an amazingly great time, as a result, this location will always hold a special place in our hearts.

*** Review is for Restaurant Week August 2104 Menu ***

I was to the VooDoo Steal restaurant about 10 years ago but hadn't been back since.  Restaurant Week gave me the impetus to go for dinner and to check out the new zip line attraction from the patio.

You have to check in on the second floor of the Rio's Masquerade Tower and then ride the glass elevator up the side of the building to the next to top floor.  The restaurant was almost empty at 5:30 when I arrived.  

I was seated quickly at a window table facing the Bellagio and other south Strip properties across the freeway.  I was soon brought menus--I had to ask for the Restaurant Week menu.  I ordered an iced tea which was soon at the table and I got a nice basket of bread.

For the first course, I got the classic French onion soup.  It was a good rendition of this soup that I haven't gotten in quite some time.

For the main course, I ordered the flat iron steak extra rare.  It was a little too cooked for me but not enough to make me grimace.  The cut by nature is not the most tender steak cut but it has a lot of good flavor.  The red wine reduction added to the good beef flavor.

For dessert, I chose the assorted ice creams.  In this case, there were three dips of ice cream, pistachio, coffee, and vanilla with some fresh berries.

Service was very good.  My empty artificial sweetener packets were removed from the table as soon as a server or busser walked by.  Iced tea was refilled before my glass was empty, and plates were cleared in a timely manner.

After I ordered, my server told me to enjoy the patio and that I should feel free to take my iced tea outside with me.  This gave me a chance to take some photos and to check out that new zip line.  When I went back in, the server said he'd start my order.  This happened on my first visit years ago, and it's a nice touch especially for tourists who want to get photos of themselves with the resort corridor hotels behind them.

This was a good meal but it's not a place I'd regularly visit.  It's nice now and then for the view, but there are better values closer to home.  But we all have to be tourists in this wonderful city and this is a good way to do it!

This has a 25p off locals discount available that is factored into my review. If paying full priceI wouldnt have been quite as happy. I have eaten here 5 times in the last year. I have never had a bad meal, the atmosphere is fine, service is spotty and can be slow. I cant complain about any of the sides or steaks thatbI have ordered, Wine isnt a bargain, as others pointed out.

Service was wonderful from the hostess who not only let us in earlier than our reservation, but recommend we sign up for free total rewards card just to get a percentage off our bill, to our kind server and bussers.  

I bought a great Groupon Deal from here for my guy and my anniversary dinner - mainly because I saw they had foie gras and it's illegal in out state of California now.  Loved it!  With the jam, bread, and greens - GAH.  We strategized our dishes to try steak, pork chops, shrimp, and lobster tail, 'cause we're cool like that, and everything was cooked and flavored perfectly.

You also can't beat that 50 floor view and the option of getting into VooDoo Lounge for free if you bring your dinner receipt later on in the night.
Great food and great service for starters, I'LL Definitely go back ~ taken care of in every since of the word, hung out and watched the game , a very laid back atmosphere and was treated like a Queen

This was my first visit to Voodoo Steak, and quite frankly will most likely be my last. The hotess we encountered to start our evening needs some work on her attitude to say the least. We were a few minutes early, so we decided to go on the outside deck and enjoy the amazing views over the city from this 50th floor restaurant. Once seated we had an amazing view again. We were given bread to start. It was very plain, but did include some raisin rolls as well(blah). We ordered the wedge salad($13) and really enjoyed it. The Lobster bisque soup came next, and had an excellent taste and left us wanting more ($12)!!  My wife ordered a Lobster, seafood dish($52) and frankly loved it. I ordered the 20oz Ribeye$(49) cooked medium Rare and this led me to my average rating. This is called Voodoo STEAK!  Well my steak was not even close to high end quality. I swear Texas Roadhouse steaks blow it away! It came out well done too! I showed the waiter, he then says "that tis really off and I will go put in another steak for you." I said well we are meeting friends at 10pm so can you rush it, "sure no problem. I apologize." After 20 minutes I decide to keep nibbling on the steak left with me. I nibbled till it was almost done and we finally see waiter again. He says kitchen is behind and its gonna be longer. I go forget it,  I finished steak(which I think was their entire goal anyway) and the $14 martini's and we left. If your wanting nice ambience, nice views, and decent service this place is fine. If your looking for premium grade steaks that are worth the expensive price, avoid!

BF decided to go here for his bday dinner. I originally had reservations for 10pm but because we had a tickets to see KA we called and moved dinner to 8 which was no problem. 

The atmosphere had a cool vibe that led up to the name but none of the decor wowed me. It was a panoramic view of the strip (well ours was part of the strip). We were seated right by a window which was great, but the beauty of  seeing the strip was ruined by a huge glare. 

We both ordered the Filet Mignon. I ordered mine medium and it came out more medium well, which i didn't mind too much. I could eat steak everyday if I could, but theirs wasn't as tender as filet mignon should be. Their filet mignon was decent. I also ordered their truffle mac and cheese and I must say that was rather delicious! I would come back for the Mac & Cheese alone. 

As for service goes... it was probably the worst I've received from an upscale restaurant. I agree with another reviewer about the service being terrible from a certain waiter. I know my BF & I are young but come on, don't make it obvious that you don't want to serve us cuz you think we won't tip well! We actually tipped more than we should have! We were rarely checked up on,it took forever to take our order, & we actually had to get up and find him to get our check. He didn't sound happy to be there or anything, we felt as if we were a bother wtf.

Would we ever go back? Possibly. If I had a different waiter, I would. I would def go get a Total Rewards card tho, saves you quite a bit of money.

If you haven't been you need to go. What a great place for date night. The view is out of this world!  The olive tapenade they bring with the bread is to die for!  Lobster bisque that is truly the essence of Lobster squeezed into a bowl!  Melt in your mouth Filet Mignon. Sweet Lobster tail and Prawns!  Sides big enough to share. And a wait staff par excellence!  What more could you want on date night?

The Black Angus ribeye steaks we ordered medium rare were wonderful and cooked to perfection. Great view, atmosphere and Samuel Nasto was our waiter. Was very attentive and took care of us. Thank you!

Best oyster shooters!  Get the lobster bisque!
Service and view were amazing!
Waiter went out of his way to retrieve my Rewards Card!  Complimentary champagne since we were celebrating two birthdays!  We had a great time and a lovely meal!

Food was ok . Service was ok . View is what makes this a great location the sunset over the mountains is very romantic and  when your done eating you have to go to roof top to enjoy the view of the strip .

My husband made reservations for use to celebrate my birthday and our wedding anniversary on Sunday Christmas Eve.
Staff was aware of this special events and did nothing to make our evening special,no cake or dessert!
I order the Halibut which was wonderful,5 star food.
Wish with what we spent on dinner we could of been treated like we counted.

My friends and I were invited to eat with one of Rio's Event Planners tonight, we had such bad service and the food was not cooked as requested. Two items did not come out till end of meal, like the Lobster Bisque and the 3 Shrimp Cocktail. The Halibut was dry and looked like a piece of chicken. I had better service as a walk in at a soft opening at Hell's Kitchen last week. Here, I ordered the grass fed steak at $58 medium rare. I received it and cut into it. To my eyes, it was almost well done! I requested for the waiter and showed him my steak. He tried to argue and said it was medium rare. After I had to bust out my flashlight and shined it on my meat I said, "that's not medium rare, it's almost done!" He then agreed, but what waiter argues with a customer? Also, a soup came out at the end of the meal to another person in the party, who serves soup after the the main course?!! Lastly, another person had to asked about her missing item that she had ordered. She was totally forgotten and embarrassed because she's the Event Planner here at the Rio. She apologizes to us, she had recommended this place. In conclusion, for a high end restaurant that is charging a high price to other comparable steak houses  in other casinos, this was a failure. Service is slow, not cooked to preference, & confrontational when questioning. It ruined my experience and any other possibility of doing business at the Rio. Voodoo Steakhouse WILL NOT be on my recommendation list. Attached is picture of first steak & the second, is the correct doneness it should of been. Photo of halibut that looked like rolled chicken breast

The atmosphere was great, our waiter was very friendly and fast, the food was ok. Probably not worth the prices they charge, but you're also paying for the atmosphere. It's up on the 50th floor of the Rio and the decor was interesting fit their voodoo theme. Prices for a steak range from $46 for a flat iron steak to $88 for their top. I'd say to try it once if you don't mind spending the money.

My first vacation to Las Vegas and I was taken to the Voodoo Steakhouse AMAZING! The service was great and the Voodoo Doctor Sampler and the Maine Lobster and Crab Pasta was to die for and the view is breath taking!!!

Nice view, inside was decorated very nicely, has the upscale feel. Balcony connected to restaurant that also is the balcony of the voodoo lounge club I ordered the filet mignon it was the best steak I've ever had, very soft my wife had the manage a trois wich is steak shrimp and lobster very good

Bad location and food! I am terrified of heights. The hostess refused to allow us to sit anywhere but looking directly out the glass 50 story Windows, even though there were many tables available. She kept insisting there was no where else we could sit. Food lacked flavor. It was bad, bad, bad and exp naive. Find sinewy else to eat

Great view & that's where it ends. Ribeye steak no sides$58.00 tough. With all the great food Vegas has to offer, this is one to pass on. Huge restaurant was almost empty, that should have served as a warning!

4 stars food, 2 stars service, 3 1/2 stars atmosphere: The food was good and reasonably priced for an upper end resturuant. The service was slow (especially in light of the fact that we went early in the evening and the place was practically empty). The atmosphere is nice and they do have a fantastic view....but the view windows were absolutely filthy....I have never seen such dirty windows in a resturant before (especially for a place in which a key feature is their view). I am not sure how these windows became so dirty (since it has to be a couple of months since the last time it rained here)....but come on guys, CLEAN THOSE WINDOWS!!!

Uncertain what a compelling reason to come here again would be. The view from the deck is very good at night - but you could accomplish that with just a quick expensive drink at the tiny bar. Waiter running around and apologizing quite a bit. Staff looked like they wanted to do better than they were. The Caesar salad was terrible - pre-made and wilted with what had to be bag croutons; at $16 it is a crime. The filet with garlic & horseradish crust very good. Had to wait a long while to get a beer and a large time gap between wilted salad and steak. Not to mention the Rio feels a little tired and less clean then I would like; feels like a Kmart that does know they are about to go under.

We went to VooDoo Steak for our Fourth of July dinner with another couple.  We were seated immediately at our 6:30pm reservation at a wonderful table right next to the windows overlooking Vegas.  We were so excited that we would be able to have dinner here, then head up to the lounge to see the Fourth of July fireworks (that never happened...I can't believe none of the strip hotels had fireworks on July 4th...WTH?).

We started with the Witch Doctor Sampler which we inhaled....my favorite was the zucchini beignets.  

We had the sea bass, braised veal, pork chop, and the bone-in ribeye.  We had no complaints...they were all equally delicious.  We had the dessert trio and a chocolate mousse cake for dessert.  They were fantastic too.

The only complaint we had was that we were not informed beforehand that we were limited to 2 hours for our dinner, and that we could get discounted prices on our dinner by presenting the rewards card for the Rio.  I think they should inform patrons when reservations are being made so that we're aware.

Other than that, we had a great time...fireworks or not.

It had been a couple of years since my last visit and I was glad to find that the food and service are still excellent at VooDoo. I mostly chose this particular steakhouse because of the rooftop bar with a nice view of The Strip. It's nice when friends and family are visiting to find a place with a nice meal and also a nice view.

We all started with a drink to enjoy with our meals. I ordered a red wine that was very good and my brother loved the IPA he ordered. My husband's Sauvignon Blanc was not good. The bread basket had salted rolls and pretzel bread. The bread was okay, but not great. The tapenade served with the bread was very good.

My meal was the Voodoo Menage A Trois. This included a six ounce filet, lobster tail, two giant prawns, and mashed potatoes. Everything on the plate was great with the filet being the stand out. Next time I'd probably just get a filet. My brother ordered the filet and really enjoyed it as well. Our side of Whipped Potatoes was creamy and delicious. My husband ventured out with the Duroc Pork Rib Eye and really enjoyed it. This meal looked more like a platter with a large serving of pork, mashed potatoes, and some roasted peaches. We were all very happy with our meals. 

Our waiter was friendly and attentive. He was on top of drink refills and making sure we had everything we needed. The waiter also encouraged us to check out the rooftop bar area with the view after we placed our orders. It was a nice spot to take some photos and take the view of The Strip in. 

After making my reservation I remembered hearing that the Rio has a locals discount for some of their restaurants. I checked out the website and found that VooDoo is 25% off with a local ID, Total Rewards card, and the printed coupon from their website. What a deal! This was the icing on the cake to a lovely meal.
Dinner was great, drinks were great. Received Togo food in aluminum foil.... just tacky and not at all FINE DINING
Christian is on point. Food is amazing. When I am impressing people, I bring them here.

This is one of the better off strip steak options.  The views are great from the time you step on the elevator.  The decor is in desperate need of updating, but the food makes up for that.

Our server was friendly and attentive.  He handled our large group well.

I started my meal with the VooDoo Style Wedge Salad.  It is a slightly different take on the wedge.  You get the standard wedge of iceberg covered in crispy cured lomo, bacon, and Maytag blue cheese.  The twist comes with the orange vinaigrette they top it with.  It is a solid salad.  The citrus makes it a little unique.

For my main course I ordered the 12 oz. filet mignon.  The filet was prepared exactly as ordered.  It was tender, juicy and flavorful.  They did a very good job seasoning it as well.  The black pepper gave it some bite.

We ordered a few sides for the table.  I tried the Confit Fried Fingerling Potatoes.  They were solid.  They may be a bit salty for some, but I was happy with them.

This is not a cheap meal by any means, but it is inline with most quality steakhouses in Las Vegas.  The views are worth the trip at least once even though it is off strip.  If you eat later you can head upstairs to the lounge after and get even better views.

Prior to seeing Eddie Griffin, we opted to eat here.  I was super on the fence about it because the reviews were really mixed, but we needed to be conveniently located to the show for when doors opened. 

The view alone is worth dining here, as it was really nice to see the city while eating.  But the bar had a lot more people at it, which doesn't enjoy the views that the dining area does.  They also have a patio you can enjoy your drinks on.

I enjoyed a glass of Prosecco and the complimentary bread that came out.  I ordered the Sea Bass or something, I honestly don't know but everything was tasty.  Hubby's steak was good, too.  

Don't like that this is in the Rio, as that to me is a dive, but it was worth it for the convenience of the show.

Went with my husband and daughter and overall, had a good time. The view is spectacular. The food: it was good not excellent. I have had better steaks in other places. Ordered a rib eye medium, it came medium well. This surprised me since places that sell steaks at $50+ usually cook them perfectly (you know, they are expensive). Anyway, told the waiter and he tried to insist that the steak was medium - excuse me sir, I KNOW the difference between medium and medium well. If I'm paying almost $100 for a meal, I also expect, at least, good service and attention. He hesitantly took the steak and went to the kitchen. They brought another rib eye and this time it was cooked perfectly (medium rare they said). I didn't like the mashed potatoes, lacked flavor and seemed too starchy. The salad, meh....not good. One good thing, the cheesecake, it was delicious. The price, this place is expensive, really expensive. More expensive than Morton's and other good steakhouses in Vegas. Will we return? Nah, don't think so. The view is spectacular and you can enjoy it from their lounge which doesn't require you to attend the restaurant.

Well lets start with the fan favorite, the view! Incredible view. We where there for the right time, 630ish with the sun setting and the casinos turning on all there lights. So I read some reviews, and one caught me, it talked about dress code. And I agreed with the reader. If youre suppose to dress up, dress up. I dont want to see people coming up in shorts and tees, But thats just me.. First impression of the place. It was fun, the art was diffferent. Got the hostess, and she directed my girlfriend and I to my parents, where they where at the bar. Decent size bar, the bar tender was nice. We then went to our table, and was greeted by our waiter. Our waiter was okay, but wasnt the best. For the amount of money you spend there, he should on his game. But lucky for us, he was a nice guy. 

The food came out in a timely fashion. The steaks where cooked to what we asked for. Everyone enjoyed there food, was quite delicious. We where to full to have dessert. But they looked amazing. Instead we had coffee and tea..Also before I forget. Get yourself the Total Rewards card, It definitely helps saving some money. So if you want to save alittle money go check it out.. 

 Afterwards we decided to head up to the voodoo club. And that was a whole different story on its own.

not cheap but delicious food - medium portions - good service. Its a special place but the view spectacular. I had the seared scallops on short ribs with gnocchi ...amazing my husband had the special steak...I had a bite it was good but not $75 good. Ive been twice and had a great meal both times!

Nice ambiance (slightly dated) and Vegas strip views. The server assistance staff was very kind and attentive. My friend and I ordered the French onion soup ($12), salmon ($38) and crab cake ($20). The French onion soup was delicious. The salmon was extremely undercooked and the crab cake was fried (not seared) and had endless filler vs "lump crab meat" as advertised. Our server seemed pretty unmoved by our poor experience. The food is sub par at a high price. Go to Mastro's instead.

The steak I had was stinky. Super stinky. I eat beef 3-6 times a week. Nice waiter, good service. 
I won't dine here again, the meat is trash. I brought mine home to feed to my dogs. I hope they like $59 steak but don't get sick from it.

Such a cool spot! The views are amazing! Seafood platter amazing!!! Drinks amazing! Server beyond amazing! I ordered the coconut shrimp and mentioned that I didn't care for it. The VP of the restaurant came over apologized and thanked me for my feedback. Overall fantastic experience! Can't wait to go back

The steak was one of the best I've had, cooked to perfection.  The sides and starters we're great too. 

I was disappointed with the creme brûlée. After the quality of good put in front of me at dinner I was expecting the best.....

The view is second to none as you look out over Las Vegas.  I'm looking forward to my next visit so I can take the zip line (wasn't open yet). 

Be aware, their 'shots' are a little bigger than most!!

Price was average for a Vegas steak house.

Hmm... we chose to go to Voodoo Steakhouse because it was in the same Hotel/Casino of a show we were catching after dinner. 

Made reservations a week in advance and was seated fairly quickly when our group arrived. I noticed it was pretty dark in here but I guess that's the atmosphere they're going for. 

Selection was decent. I didn't do family style with others because I knew there would be at least half meat choices so I ordered a crab cake to eat alone, something light before a night at XS. Lol. 

While we waited for our food, we went outside to the rooftop lounge and took pictures for quite some while. I came back to the table twice to check the food but it wasn't out yet. I guess the servers were waiting for our party to return to serve our food so that it was nice and hot. 

My crab cake was okay but I wished I ordered a second dish or a side dish to eat but the side dish was too large of a portion for just 1 person (it says it serves up to 4)! 

I don't remember how much my meal came out to but I agree to the 3 stars rating. Probably won't be returning because it isn't anything spectacular, just average.

A friend recommended VooDoo Steakhouse and I decided to check it out while I was in Vegas for a conference. It's located at the Rio and has great view of the Strip. Food is great and definitely worth the price. Will visit again next time I am in Vegas.

I gave this place 1 star for the great view.
If not for that it would have received a zero.
I ordered the coconut shrimp for appetizer and that was good, 4 prawns fried well in a mango sauce.
I ordered a 20 oz Ribeye on the bone.
Of the 20 ounces, there was 5 ounces of meat and that meat wasn't even that good. The rest of it was fat and bone. Seriously guys? what kind of steak is that to serve to a customer? When I pointed it out to the server he was like yeah thats a lot of fat. Not sure what kind of customer service that was. Good thing I had a coupon for 25% off.
They were lucky I was not hungry due to the previous evening's amazing food at Andre's, which charged the same price for their steak yet it was a 1000 times better.

Guys do not serve inferior steak, you just lost a customer for life and I will tell everyone to avoid Voodoo Steak.

3 1/2 stars, but I'm feeling friendly because it was a nice experience. The 3 1/2 total rating is incredibly accurate. 

Had a really nice dinner here. The service was solid, view was beautiful, and while the food wasn't memorable, it was really good. 

PROS: As most say, the view of the LV Valley. They have a nice deck where you can go out and lounge and take in the view. 

The service was nice and efficient.

Everything tasted good, but nothing rocked my socks so much I would have to come back for it. My husband really enjoyed his ribeye, and he's hard to please. So you get a whole star added to your rating for that. 
Truffle Mac and cheese was also tasty.

There is a 20% discount if you show your Penn & Teller tickets.. Which you'll need because...

CONS: it's much too pricey for the quality! This is fine dining prices but Outback Steakhouse quality dishes. Yes, it's plated nicely and yes the restaurant is pretty, but you're not going to get a unique flavor explosion here. It's good, just nothing to write home about. 

The Witch Doctor is a giant and cool looking drink but it's $31! Buyer beware. The price is not on the menu... That should have been our first clue. 

My $13 salad I could have thrown together at home. It was mediocre tomatoes, bitter lettuce, crumbled soggy burrata, and a light drizzle of balsamic. Ehh. If you're a fine steakhouse, please use high quality produce, cheese, and balsamic. 

The bread had potential but was rock hard. 

Overall, a nice meal, a nice view, and other than my empty wallet, nothing substantial to complain about not look forward to for next time.
We had a great dinner and good service. We laughed so much and enjoyed the view. I would recommend going if you have time. Queensland steak was one of the best steaks I have ever had.

50 stories up !!  Yikes !!  Yes i will admit i have a fear with heights but after alot of drinks i made it up to the top. The food here was amazing !  The service was world class. But you get what you pay for here. Would i come back... yeah probably once i'm not ballin on a budget .

I barely log on to Yelp but had to share.  This was by far my favorite place on the strip - I ate here with my points at least once every few weeks for over a year.  It's been a couple months since I have been in and they have since changed the menu.  Although I am deeply saddened they eliminated the Heirloom Tomato salad which was the best in the country, I understand things have to be changed up sometimes.  However, the bread was insulting enough to log in to write about it.  When you pay $60 for a steak, you want more than prepackaged dinner rolls and a pretzel roll.  Not comparing to the amazing bread they used to serve, but a pretzel roll puts this at the "bar food" level not the $60 per steak level.  The steak was fantastic as usual (though mine was served medium rare not medium).  The service was still great, though he was uninformed of the yelp promotion.  (The Amuse was AMAZING!)

Absolutely worth the price!

Let's face it, prices in Vegas on the strip are high and this place is no exception. However, this place is totally worth the price!

Upon our arrival we asked for a window seat. They were fortunately able to accommodate our last-minute request within only a few minutes of our arrival. The views were amazing and we had the added bonus of watching the strip lights come on once the sun set. Beautiful. 

A bread basket is standard for all parties and service was friendly and efficient. I noticed a party next to us of over-sized drinks that looked fun but I wasn't drinking that night so I can't comment on the alcohol. 

My friend had the filet mignon and I had the scallops. Both were perfectly prepared and plated. I was very impressed with attention to detail. We also ordered several sides large enough for sharing. The lobster mac and cheese was okay although not as good as other posts suggest. However, if you're not worrying about carbs, worth a try. We also tried the green beans and the spinach. Both were good as well. 

If you're on a budget and would still like to try this gem, I would recommend a salad and side. Probably just as satisfying at 1/3 the cost.

Don't forget to go out on the viewing deck before or after your meal. It's beautiful to say the least.

Spent way too much money on so-so food. My salmon wasn't cooked all the way but I ate it anyway. Pretty bland too. Nothing with it other than a few sliced baby heirloom tomatoes. No sauce. My bf had the chicken. The taste was really good. He also got a side of whipped potatoes--best tasting item of the night. Pretty sad huh?! Waiter talked us into their homemade creme brûlée, my favorite dessert. Again, bland. Not much vanilla flavor AND they used Cool Whip rather than real whipped cream! The ambiance is nice except for the table of ten drunk girls who were hooting and hollering all night. It was my bf's birthday and I wanted to take him somewhere nice with a nice ambiance. After all, when you spend $150 on dinner, part of what you're paying for is the experience, right? I really think the wait staff or management should have said something. Either that or put couples on one side and partying groups on another. Also when I made reservations, Open Table had asked if this was a special occasion. I said that it was a birthday dinner. No one said "happy birthday" or put a candle in our dessert or any kind of acknowledgement. Why do they ask if they aren't going to at least MENTION it!!??!!

Great service, good food, nice views - especially from the patio/deck, strong drinks.  What more could you ask for?

The lighting is romantic, the service was very good, the food was certainly good.  Not an extensive menu and maybe a little overpriced, but all in all I would go again.

If you show up early, do the zip line with the local discount, it's a fun 2 minutes.
Spectacular steak. Incredible atmosphere above average sides.  Meal includes entry to the night club.
I thought the dinner was really good! Good beer selection and the waiter was on it and friendly. We had the sea bass and lamb chops plus a side of French onion soup. Plenty of food and delicious.

We come every time we are in town. Wagyu is delicious and service is phenomenal, plus you really can't beat the views!

Would like to see a couple new items introduced but otherwise yum yum

Lovely heirloom tomato salad, but I would have been very happy to share it, because it was so large.  The view of Vegas was wonderful, but the prices were a little steep.  Next time, we'll Yelp for help.

I was lucky enough to go to the voodoo steak twice on this trip to Vegas.  First was mothers day.  Although there was a special menu, we picked our favorite items off both menus.  We had crab cake.  These are the best of the best.  No filler. Only 100% crab meat with light crumbs to fry them lightly.  WOW. These are the real deal.  I had the black cod.  It you can't get to Nobu, the cod at the voodoo lounge's just as good and probably even better.  The rib eye was perfection.  Perfection--perfection temp, perfect seasoning and tender as you would hope for.  Then came the presentation of  the bananas foster..  The rum and carmel sauce when lit on  fire and poured over the bananas and rum raisin ice cream was so impressive.  If you have the change
To eat at the voodoo steak,  grab it. You won't be sorry.

Many years ago the Voo Doo Lounge was one of my parents favorite restaurants and they ate here every time they came to Vegas.  Since then several new hotels and restaurants have popped up and although the RIO is a nice hotel it's definitely now one of the older ones and so is this restaurant.

I was more than excited to try this place, I was with a few co workers and since we were staying at the RIO, it made sense to have dinner here this evening.  For drinks I enjoyed the sangria which was fabulous followed by a glass of red with dinner, I've heard the witches brew drink is amazing but I was with my boss and co worker so I didn't want to get too crazy :).  The food and the service unfortunately I wasn't impressed with.  I felt very rushed and I really like to sit back and dine for hours upon end at a nice restaurant like this.  I also thought it was extremely expensive, now I don't mind paying $40 for a salmon dish as long as it's truly mouth watering and the side of veggies isn't just 2 pieces of cauliflower.  The one thing I'm picky with is the temperature of food, I like my food piping hot, I don't know what it was this week but everything I had was just warm.

I ordered the salmon dish, the plate was cold so obviously the fish went cold quickly, I even heat my plates in the oven at my own house when I'm cooking myself a hot meal.  We also ordered a few sides including the mushrooms and asparagus which came out 10 minutes after our meal, it would have been nice to have our sides with our meals.  Again these weren't very hot either and by the time they got to me and onto my cold plate they were freezing.  My salmon was okay, nothing special compared to any other piece of salmon I've had, I enjoyed the mushrooms, the wine was good and I have to say the one thing I enjoyed the most was the cracker/pita bread thing that came out with the bread when we arrived.  We didn't have dessert and because we said no to dessert the next thing you know, plates are cleared and the bill is on the table and we were out the door.  One trick I've learned is to always accept a dessert menu as it saves you time from being so rushed out.

The view is gorgeous and the rooftop upstairs is beautiful and a great spot to have your a picture taken but overall I'm just not that impressed.  I think so many other amazing places have popped up since the hype of the VooDoo opened.  I'd go back if the prices were a bit lower, portions were a bit bigger and my food was piping hot!

Husband and I had dinner last night . We went to celebrate his birthday but u would never guess it was his birthday since the staff ignore the fact that I told them . The table next to us had free desert for her bday. Anyway we ordered. 20oz ribeye with a salad , soup and asparagus. Our salad and soup came out right away but the steak came out like 45 minutes later. We asked for it to be cooked medium and when it finally got to our table it was cold and medium rare . My husband refused to eat it saying he was full . I know he wasn't so I sent it back to Cook some more . Once it came back nice and warm the steak tasted ok. Not worth $58 dlls but just ok. Our waitress offered us desert for the inconvenience and when the bill came she charged us for the desert. We didn't say anything cause we didn't want to look like cheap skates . The best part of this restaurant is the ambience. Beautiful view and the staff is super friendly. We ended our night dancing at the night club upstairs which was entertaining due to the diverse crowd. Weather was perfect too. Probably won't be back to eat there but it was a nice experience either way.
