Had dinner here with 5 other friends this past Friday. Ambiance was ok, a little on the darker side and there was quite a bit of noise. Not just from the diners and hustle n bustle from the staff. A quite bit of noise was emanating from the upstairs lounge. Great view of the strip if you look out the wall-to-wall windows overlooking this 50th floor restaurant. Service was very good all around. The prices were similar to other steak houses. They gave a basket of breads: a raisin wheat roll, sourdough roll and some parm lavosh. I had the prime 14oz flat iron steak which was nice n juicy. Some sides like broccoli, fries and some mix consisting of potatoes, onions, asparagus n bacon. Everyone ordered different items and it seemed all was good. A few got desserts and even a witch doctor cocktail. The witch doctor and sorbets, they all came bubbling like some hot cauldron thanks to dry ice.
After dinner everyone went outside to the balcony to take pictures of the strip then left overall satisfied.

I loooove this restaurant!  Amazing city views, great food, reasonable prices, and very unique cocktails!  My friend ordered one that was frothing with fog from dry ice.  Very cool spot.  Live music upstairs.  Highly recommend!

Beautiful view from the 50th floor of The Rio. We went around 7pm and the servers were nice enough to seat us by the window. I had their amazing Giant Crab Cake... no fillers, it was all crab meat... every bite was amazing. Their pan seared scallops on top of braised short ribs just melts in your mouth! My husband's steak was "the best" he's ever had! Portions were good. A fine place to check out!

I came here on a Saturday night for birthday dinner and the food was excellent. I had the steak tar-tare as an appetizer, an 8oz. steak with truffle mac and cheese, and then a piece of the chocolate mouse cake for dessert (complimentary for my birthday). My table shared the witch doctor drink which was fun for us because of the fog coming out of the goblet. Everything tasted really good and fresh, but the service was kind of slow. 4 stars for the great food and friendly server (even though he was a bit slow). 

PS: If you choose to eat here while the night club is going on, I believe it is free to enter after dinner. I didn't really like the music that they played (top 40 from 2009-2013) when I checked out the club, but there were a lot of people there.

We had a reservation for 630 pm. Table had a very nice view and our requests were met for a table along the window. The greeter downstairs was not over friendly but took our name and said go to 50th floor. We had questions about getting back into the lounge after the show. She had no idea the answers to how we do that. But in future you just get a stamp from the security when you come out. 

Bus staff was more of an assistance than our actual waiter. We were greeted immediately by her and she poured waters and made she we all were settled. 

Waiter can about 15 min after we sat and we ordered drinks and seafood platter. Which seafood platter is basically bar food appetizer with fried coconut shrimp4, crab cake 1, 4 frog legs and some shrimp. Not anything spectacular. We got our appetizer when our entrees were  coming out over 1 wait. When we asked for the appetizer first it was like we were asking for the world. We wanted to enjoy food. 

Lamb loin honestly was worst lamb I have ever ate. Didn't taste like lamb it was like a sausage of some sort. Creamed spinach was good just slightly over cooked but all our food probably day under heat lamps to be honest because we waited hour for appetizer. 

Other than our bus staff services was not all that great for expensive place. Just paying for the view and many of other great places

Awesome location, great food, amazing views. I was there a few weeks ago when it was energy day. All the lights were off on the strip and we saw them all turn on from the roof. It was pretty cool. Will go  back next time I'm in town. Make sure you do the zip line before you eat.

On on 1/1/2016 - we checked in at our hotel and decided that we were starving. Met up with a good friend of mine from high school with her hubby. We didn't want have to leave our hotel & drive or have to deal of getting a cab or Uber so we decided stay put and picked this place. We ordered Ceasar Salad, Shrimp Cocktail as appetizer. The Shrimp Cocktail was yummy - the sauce was perfect. Both of my girl friends ordered their scallops with grits and mushroom. I ordered the crab and lobster pasta salad with cream sauce. Jay ordered their Filet, another friend ordered Rib Eye and Salmon. Jay's filet was overcooked - he asked for medium rare and it came medium. It was more cooked than he and I liked. The scallops were delicious - melt in your mouth! Loved the flavor. Our friends liked their salmon and Rib Eye. Mine was disappointingly ok - the crab was cooked a little too long so it was a little rubbery. There wasn't much cream in the sauce and just needed more flavor. We were starving so no one bothered to complain. We also ordered sides - asparagus, truffle Mac & Cheese and French Fries. The asparagus was too al-dente for my taste, loved the Truffle Mac & Cheese and of course, you can't possible go wrong with Pomme Frits!!! Their selection of bread was good as well. And love the view! I just wished for the price we paid for dinner, it was perfect. Can't have it all I guess.

We ate here two years ago and everything was fantastic. Ate here last spring after they added 'Steakhouse' to their name and the food and service went downhill. The witch doctor cocktail is still worth the visit though.

I eat here all the time. My favorite steakhouse in Vegas hands down. Great service and the bartender is fantastic. Now here is my complaint. The security from the club and the hostess downstairs are really starting to change my opinion of the Hotel as a whole. They tried telling me I couldn't go to the restaurant for a drink and I had to pay to go to the club instead. I spend quite a bit in this casino and don't like this sort of treatment. In my opinion the club upstairs is really downgrading the overall experience I've come to expect.

Thieves!

The dinner was good, the service wasn't bad until I got my charges back from the credit card company. Someone, waiter? manager? changed the tip amount on my bill doubling it, hence the reason that I caught it. Watch your charges here! Certainly leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

What an experience! It's pricy but worth every minute.. I had their Softshell Crab served with grilled green beans...wow! It was Amazing! My friend invited me here for dinner and decided to go all out, she loved this place and was craving to experience it again with me! The dessert was $12.00, but I've always wanted to go back just to have it again. It was house made butter pecan ice cream served in a house made large waffle bowl with banana slices and chocolate syrup drizzled on top! It's the Bomb! It's so delicious...that you don't care if it's that large? They offer to take your picture there, so we took one...beautiful pictures, what can I say...the food is like French cuisine...very select portions, but it fills though. The service is top notch...a must recommend! It can be very romantic because of the views, being you're at the 51st floor of the Rio Suites Hotel...

You simply cannot beat the view from this restaurant located at the top of the Rio! There's a great view from almost every table and you can go outside for an even more amazing view. The service was also amazing - very attentive! The drinks are pricey, but pretty much what you'd expect at a steakhouse in Vegas. If I was just basing this review on the view and the service, it would easily be 4 or 5 stars. Unfortunately, I wasn't very happy with my steak, considering the high price. I got the Filet Mignon, medium. It was flavorless and a bit dry. I didn't even finish it! Luckily, I got the truffle mac & cheese on the side and THAT was great! 

My friend was happy with his steak, so I do think I would return and try something else from the menu. If nothing else, you should make a reservation here, keep your expectations in check and just enjoy the view.

The food was very good a bit pricey but not unreasonable. The service could use some work. Our waiter wasn't very attentive and he took a long time to retrieve things we asked him for, also never refilled our drinks.
We went to the Rio Casino for the first time . Just so we could try the steakhouse.  The service was phenomenal and the food superb.

Staying in the hotel on business. I stopped by the restaurant desk last night and specifically asked the man at the desk about table availability for a single diner tomorrow, on Valentine's Day. No problem, they will have open tables, no need for a reservation. Today at 6:45 I showed up and was told no, reservations only,  no walk-ins. More great service from incompetent staff. I'm in Vegas almost monthly. This is my first and last time at Rio. This was the last straw.

A must do in Vegas ! Food and drinks are great and the team is very friendly and efficient ! I came here over 12 times and always had a blast. Even when it's crowded food is fresh and comes quickly to the table with a kind word from your server. While you make up your mind on the menu you can enjoy a cocktail or a glass of white wine with complimentary fresh bread and tapenade. The icing on the cake is the outdoor patio on the top of Masquerade tower where you can go to finish your drink with an amazing view of Las Vegas... Brought friends and family and everyone enjoyed ! On my last two visits my server was Jacinto and i was so happy to have him again 2 weeks ago because he is very nice and professional. The restaurant was not too busy so he took time to come and talk since i was by myself. We had a picture together and i hope to see him again on my next visit in december...

One of the best views in town... and the food is marvelous... (tip go early... like 5:30 when they open and you can get a table by the window....) I usually just show up as they open, have a martini and a couple of appetizers... what a lovely light meal in a beautiful location...

This was an amazing experience. The view from the 50th floor was spectacular! The Tomahawk Ribeye was hands down one of the best steaks I've ever had. I did not give 5 stars because our server, although polite, paid much more attention to his other tables than to us. Also the food took unusually long compared to others around us. The food was worth the wait.

Went here for drinks last night and it was just okay.  The view is fantastic but the old fashioned had a lot to be desired.  Too sweet and not enough bourbon...btw they don't even have rye.  This is supposed to be an upscale place but it misses the mark.  I have heard the food is good so maybe you will have better luck.  The staff was very friendly....better cocktails needed though please!

This place is a must if you want to impress and get some action from your guest while in Vegas.  They serve prime steak so enough said the food is great no matter what you order.  Sides, desert all good, just what you expect in a prime steakhouse. Here is the real treat.... The roof top lounge on the 51 floor of the Rio, the steakhouse gives you access.  The Las Vegas Blvd views are breathtaking especially at night with all the lights, there is a great DJ and bar up the with dancing, what a great finish to a great meal. Definitely a comeback place.

What an amazing experience. Not just a meal. An EXPERIENCE.  

From the moment we were seated, we were surrounded by PHENOMENAL food, OUTSTANDING service ( thanks John & Manny) and entertainment as we watched countless brave souls cross the zip line. 

John knew the menu like he had designed it himself (I think I overheard him say he has worked there twenty plus years).  

The lobster bisque was DREAMY. 

We enjoyed our meal and then spent a few minutes in the cool night air on the roof of the 50th floor taking pictures for ourself and others. 

Destined to be a favorite memory.

My wife and I were in town for a long weekend. Since we were seeing Penn and Teller at the Rio on Saturday night, VooDoo Steakhouse was an obvious choice. In a nutshell, it was average at best. The food was good, the service was ok, and the overall experience  didn't justify the cost. My wife and I eat out frequently and aren't afraid to pay a premium for a premium experience. Gordon Ramsey Steak is a premium experience; VooDoo Steak is an OK experience. Several Yelp reviewers were impressed that they were invited to go upstairs and check out the view from VooDoo lounge while their dinner was being prepared. We had to ask our server if this would be OK, and after we declined dessert, he was pretty much through with us, but said we could if we wanted to. Was it special? No. Was it awful? No. Would we go back? Probably not as there are too many other options in Las Vegas to be explored.

My family and I ate here just last night, and we had a fantastic experience. They were very accommodating as we had my 10 month old daughter with us. The food and the service were great! The view and the atmosphere made the evening quite enjoyable. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because I had been here years ago and the decor was incredible! They really played to the "voodoo" theme, shrunken heads and black lights galore. However this time around they had obviously redecorated and I was really disappointed in the new decor. Very plain, nothing special.  But besides that I would definitely recommend this place to friends.

We had an early 6:45 reservation. Despite many trips to Vegas I had never heard of this steakhouse.  The view is amazing and what distinguishes it from others if the ability to be outside in their rooftop at the 57th floor with almost a 360 view. It was also great to be there during daylight hours, through sunset and into evening. 
My GF Ordered the foie gras and said it was perfect. The plate was beautifully presented. We split an order of the Voodoo Ménage a Trois which was 6 oz of fillet mignon, 2 large grilled shrimp, a lobster tail, asparagus, and mashed potatoes.  Everything was cooked perfectly and the kitchen split the plate for us, all of which was presented lovely. 
Our waiter, Jacinto, was one of the best I've had in Vegas.  And at less than $100, I thought this was a good value for Vegas.

Didn't know what to expect really. Being off the strip on on the roof attached to a night club I expected over priced and average at best food. They have this signature drink that is kind of cool because it comes out all smokey. It is way over priced though. That being said, they have this $70 waygu steak that could be the best steak I have ever eaten. I have eaten a lot of steaks and it was really phenomenal. That combined with the views make it worth the visit

The Rio looks and feels like an old hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised by the voodoo steakhouse, Great view and ambiance from something like the 50th floor. The food and service were also excellent.

I had an excellent frog legs appetizer followed by a wonderful Chilean sea bass.

Since we were starving having been in the road for a few hours, we called for reservations before getting to the steakhouse. Upon our arrival at the entrance was some dense attendant who acted like he didn't understand what "reservation" meant. After getting past him, everyone else who waited on us was pretty friendly. Our meal was good overall and I'm sorry I don't remember everything we ordered but if I could suggest something, it would be to pass on the frogs legs as they were a bit bland.
If you are looking for a steakhouse with a view in Vegas this is your spot! Located 51 stories above the strip inside the Rio. This Steakhouse you will not forget! Don't forget about dessert!

Came here on a Sunday night.  was pretty mellow.  service was amazing, from the manager to the servers.  everyone was down to earth and patient.  We each ordered the 20oz bone in Ribeye.  That sumbitch was phenomenal!  5 stars for that alone.  This place is a must try if you're in Vegas.
At the Rio Hotel and Casino Las Vegas. Great night with my cousin and my girl. Good food and an Awesome view!

Awful....
Not classy at all. First off, you are not greeted in a professional manner. No, instead they automatically assume you are going to the club on the 51st, level even after checking on your reservation. 

You then have to take an elevator. Where another hostesses asked if you have a reservation. I'm confused did the hostess downstairs not just call? 
Then we were told to wait, so we did....... plenty of open tables, plenty! 
We were then ushered to our table underneath a fluorescent flood light. Where the rest of the restaurant is dim like the nature of a steakhouse. I did asked to be moved to a not so spotlighted table. We were given menus and told our server would be with us shortly.
Now, at this point and time it has already been 30mins since we arrived. 
Our table attendant came over and asked if we would be drinking wine, I replied I do not know yet. Which at that time he then sighed, and removed all the stem wear from the table. So no I guess the answer is..no we will not have wine. And poured us water, then hastily left. 
During this whole time our new table was by 7 boys, yes boys not men. 7 boys in shorts t-shirts and baseball caps. All loud, and eating with no home training

Our server finally made his way to our table. We both placed orders to start with the steakhouse French onion soup, and we would order after looking at the menu some more. He came back not 2 mins later. "So what else will you be eating". I replied, that we were still deciding. 

During our soup wait our server was so I'm patient and impolite that he kept bombarding into the back of my chair like a bull. 

Finally 1 hour after our reservation started we finally get soup. Burnt over salted, tasted like from a can. French onion soup. I refused to eat mine and sent it back. My husband starved at this time ate his. 

I wanted nothing more than to go!!!! 
Asked our server for our check, my soup was still on it....

We have enjoyed many steakhouses from coast to coast. 

I really hope this is not their standard.

We enjoyed dinner here on a Saturday night during Superbowl weekend.  This place is awesome!

The views of the strip are incredible from your seat but with dinner you get free access to the club level where you can go outside and experience the views from their rooftop bar.  

It's a steak place but all of their food was great!  We started with the crab artichoke dip - it was just OK.  The heirloom tomato salad was scrumptious.  In our party of four, we had the veal, sea bass and two different cuts of steak - one with the horseradish crust.  Every entree was awesome!  

The service was very attentive, friendly and helpful.  

We will definitely eat here again!
The steak was out of this world,  I will be back it was a little pricey but worth it,  you also get into the night club with your meal

Wasn't  sure about this steakhouse based on the inconsistency of the reviews; however, the food and service was absolutely SUPERB! While extremely pricey, it exceeded my expectations. Ribeye extremely  tender, scallops melted in my mouth. Asparagus seasoned well. Other guests enjoyed lobster, filet, rack of lamb and chicken. 

Great view of strip although it is an off strip hotel. Waiters tended to every need. 

Dessert was top of the line as well.

Check it out

Fantastic dinner option if staying at The Rio, or the nearby Vegas Strip and willing to travel. Absolutely blown away by Voodoo Steak and their level of top-tier food and service. The view from on top was amazing, and allowed for access to the outside deck and photo ops at The Zipline. The braised veal cheek appetizer was phenomenal, and the perfect lead to what was one of the best 12 oz. filet mignon steaks I've ever had. My wife's lobster was spot on, and served with a drawn butter which could undoubtedly be described as glorious. Every dish was cooked to perfect medium/med-rare, flawlessly seasoned, and paired brilliantly with complimentary accoutrement. A side of the intoxicating truffle mac 'n cheese was the perfect (and only) way to complete what was for us a fantastic dining experience.  Our dinner plans for future Lost Wages trips have instantly been compromised, as Voodoo was one for the memories.

With Groupon in hand, we at last made it to VooDoo Steak with another couple,  Bread was good, but butter had to be requested twice.  Classic French Onion Soup was exactly that, with a thick cover of melted cheese and well-caramelized onions.  Initially our server mistakenly brought Coconut Shrimp to our table instead of the Shrimp Cocktail we ordered.  But when the switch was made, the Shrimp Cocktail was excellent, with large shrimps resting on a bed of lettuce.  A Caesar Salad was peppery but good.  Appetizer, soup, and salad all came together, but we had enough time to eat all the preliminaries before our entrees arrived.

My entree of an 8 oz. Fillet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce was medium rare as ordered, and very tender.  Additional requested Bearnaise Sauce was not listed on the menu, but was cheerfully supplied, and very good.  The large Baked Potato accompanying the steak was properly prepared but did not contain enough chives to my liking, so the manager brought me more.  Sauteed Wild Mushrooms further enhanced our enjoyment of the meals set before us.

It was somewhat noisy near the top of the Rio's Masquerade Tower, from conversations at adjoining tables.  But our excellent view of the Strip far below easily compensated for this.  And, a delicious slice of creamy, old-fashioned New York-style Voodoo Cheesecake served with fresh berries topped off a fine meal.  A bountiful assemblage of fresh blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries was strategically placed on top of and wedged around the generous portion of Cheesecake.

4-1/2 stars on this lovely night!

Sehr gutes Fleisch, super Aussicht auf den Strip und danach noch Zugang zur Bar im 51. Stock.
Die Portionen waren riesig und geschmacklich klasse. Abstriche gab es nur beim Ambiente, etwas zu Dunkel und alte Einrichtung, aber zum Steak essen mit Ausblick in Las Vegas eine absolute Empfehlung.

I have to say service was great but food not so much. My husband said his steak was good but his Brussel sprouts were undercooked and bitter. I had the Scallops and they were over cooked and over salty leaving them inedible. Leave it to say we will not be returning...

Been there , done that, got the t-shirt, etc. location, view, bar, etc., is  nice. Patio with zip line is nice. Food is nice. Exceptional? Well, the popovers are really good. Dinner was not as good as the popovers, frankly. Went for a good steak on the recommendation of friends. They raved about it . When I next saw them I told them  we didn't go rather than tell them it was not very good. Service was average, something I notice happens in the better restaurants in town if you don't order drinks or a bottle of wine to start. As for the steak..? I think the term is ?..fuggedaboudit. Wife's filet ordered medium was really rare, sent back to return well done. She couldn't eat it. Mine was medium rare but  nothing I would go back for. If I remember, bill with tip was about $170. 
 We DO really enjoy their recipe for popovers, though. With a steak on the grill from a supermarket nearby.

Had dinner here last weekend at the Rio.  The view was nice,  ordered the oysters and they weren't bad.  We ordered a couple of Prime Ribeye steaks for $58 each and some green beans,  I wasn't expecting Nirvana but what they actually served us appeared and tasted like like large cheap sirloins I'd pay about $7 for at the market.  Another peeve was that they were barely seared.  I would have been happy with a properly cooked mediocre grade Ribeye.  We left very disappointed.

I will give this restaurant 5 stars! Atmosphere and music were great! The waiter was nice and the photographer was pleasant. No wait when we were checking in for dinner. The views were amazing. As far as the food- we had the Mac n Cheese- yummy. Asparagus was tasty and we had the Australian Wagyu Steak (we shared the steak and the side were family style) OMG it was delicious, flavorful, well seasoned and cooked right. We shared all 3 items and were stuffed.. Forget the desserts, no room. Yes it is pricey but the quality of the food was well worth the money- you only live life once so enjoy it!  We will be coming back!!

i was here long time ago, and i still have good memories. we went to the roof top club after we had dinner... but... the dinner was excellent... i had the special that night, which was half a lobster and 8oz filet... this was the best for the taste, and also for the pocket. thats my two favorite combo. however, one of own friend did not get his plate almost 15 minutes later, he ordered same thing i did... other then that, the view of the strip is awesome as we were dinning  on our dinner and the service was excellent. i would come back here again

The food was amazing. The service was a little slower than I would have expected since it wasn't that busy. All of the sides we tried: Mac and cheese, asparagus, and mushrooms (my personal favorite) were great. The Cesar salad had a great flavor and the steak (medium rare) was cooked to perfection

The rating for 5 stars is solely off the food alone! It's that good! The chef definitely knows what he's doing. Kudos because you have my loyalty at this point. The most delicious lamb and couscous dish hands down, appetizers and drinks to die for and dessert menu is very fun and beautiful to look at. I can tell whoever is in the kitchen really enjoys food which I appreciate because I do too.

Service is meh. Very relaxed maybe even borderline unprofessional but you can't expect great service from a union establishment. Restaurant decor is dated but I'm not that shallow. I'm there for the food. When I went there there, almost everything I wanted from the wine list they didn't have. But a lovely view to have when you do end up getting a drink. I would consider this a hidden gem in Las Vegas.
